node.description: Ceremonial swords line the copper-painted walls, representing some of the goods that might be found here. Oak railing separates the area from a precarious drop to the room below where the receptionist waits to announce tables opening to the incoming customers.

node.name: Riverhaven Trader Market, Silver Room
node.description: Rolled scrolls and trinkets painted to look like cambrinth stones hang on the silver-textured walls, representing some of the goods that might be found here. Oak railing separates the area from a precarious drop to the room below where the receptionist waits to announce tables opening to the incoming customers.

node.name: Thringol's Weapon Shop, Salesroom
node.description: A magnificent display of crushing and smashing weapons is arrayed behind the counter. Each is engraved with the name of its original owner, however time and use has rendered the engraving too faint to read. A single shield sits proudly on the west wall with a small sign attached to it. Thringol himself gruffly cleans some dirt off the other instruments of death that he has offered up for sale. He shuffles about in his dirty socks while his boots rest in the corner of the shop.

node.name: Mirglyn Sisters, Goldsmiths
node.description: Brightly burning lamps hang above the low felt-topped tables used by the Mirglyn sisters in their work. Small glass-front drawers holding assorted metal clasps and other findings used in the jewelers' creations line the back of each bench.

node.name: Smaragdaus' Joy, Front Room
node.description: This shop is filled with perfume scents and the underlying aroma of chocolate. Despite the humble surroundings, this business offers quality gifts for the romantic. A square box sits above the large hole cut into the ceiling, obviously an attempt to reach a taller market.

node.name: Smaragdaus' Joy, Scrivener's
node.description: Fragrant bundles of drying tobacco in white cheesecloth bags hang from the rafters, perfuming the dusty air. Assorted overturned boxes surround a rickety table topped by cards and a stack of painted wooden chips, evidently the site of a regular game. In the far corner, beneath a window, sits a slant-topped desk holding an array of pens and paper.

node.name: Noot's Teahouse, Main Room
node.description: Patrons of the teahouse enjoy peaceful conversation while sipping and munching on the establishment's splendid edibles. A wavering stream of cinnamon smoke wanders carelessly through the room. Carmellia Noot can be found either helping customers or talking to two young elven gentlemen who are sitting at the counter.

node.name: Ss'Thran's Locks, Workroom
node.description: This room is a place of shadows and darkness. The few windows are heavily-curtained so that little light filters in. A shaded lantern on a shelf throws dancing pools of light that illuminate little. There is a glitter of scales, a flash of ivory fangs as Ss'Thran turns his chill gray eyes on you. A faint hiss escapes him as he inquires your business.

node.name: Cecelia's Blossoms, Showroom
node.description: The fragrances of sweet roses and spicy lavender intermingle, creating a heady perfume that fills this small shop. Twisted vines, potted plants and brilliant floral arrangements completely hide the walls, creating a tropical jungle-like atmosphere. The air feels heavy with humidity from the multitude of moisture-laden plants. Cecelia, a willowy Elven woman, smiles at you from her side of an elaborately carved acanth wood counter.

node.name: Anthelorm's Gems and Curios, Purchasing Office
node.description: Your first glance at this elegant shop is confusing. Instead of the expected cases and shelves of gleaming gemstones and expensive items, the room seems almost bare. Only one table can be seen and that is small and simple. On one wall is one small display case with only three items. The lady of the shop bustles up to you in a rustle of crisp silks and a whiff of something exotic and smiles delicately.

node.name: Fara's Furs, Showroom
node.description: Furs of all types and styles are arranged meticulously in display cases in front of you as you peruse the room. Caps, backpacks, vests and other items that once were the furs of some of the finest creatures that live are shown. Fara herself stands behind the counter wearing a striped fur coat and carrying an air of superiority, knowing that traders from all over the province come to her first before they would even think of looking at another's furs.

node.name: Noel's Arms, Showroom
node.description: The weapon shop is a clean well-lit room with a green tiled floor and whitewashed walls. A long wooden counter runs all along the back wall, blocking access to the open doorway leading into the workshop. Peering through the door, you can see apprentice swordsmiths engaged in a variety of tasks. Some clean and polish weapons, another sits before a spinning stone wheel, carefully grinding a fine edge onto a rapier blade.

node.name: Riverhaven Exterior, Southwest Gate
node.description: A narrow gate leads through the fortified wall here, providing travelers with access to the town. Too small for wagons, this area's peacefulness is shattered only by the occasional hoof-beat. Through the gate can be viewed a mixed selection of dwellings. To the south a guard stands in a tower carefully watching the horizon, ready to sound the alarm if needed. A wide, well traveled path heads off to the northwest.

node.name: Riverhaven, Floating Platform
node.description: This small floating platform, tied to a dockside ladder, gently rocks with the motion of the Faldesu. Emerging from the river beneath the wharf are great heaps of refuse, consisting mostly of splintered lumber: perhaps the wreckage of boats lost in some recent storm or battle. A dark gap between two such piles leads deep under the wharf.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: The river lies blind in the vast shadow cast by the wharf overhead. However, soft moonlight is visible through a gap between the heaps of broken, barnacled timbers, dancing across the river's surface.

The river lies blind in the vast shadow cast by the wharf overhead. However, sunlight pierces the gloom and reaches its fingers through a gap between heaps of broken, barnacled timbers to set the Faldesu ablaze with sparkling brilliance.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: The planking overhead is in especially good repair, sealing out light almost entirely. Though the remains of the former section of wharf and the building that fell through it lie heaped all about, a sort of path has been cleared through the rubble, curving from the south to the northwest.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: A wooden fishing bobber floats serenely by on its way downriver to the open sea. Bits of leaves and moss collect around a piling, rising and falling with the water as a few fish try to stay under the cover of the moss. A rectangular gap in the planking overhead suggests someone might fish this spot regularly.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Unnerved by the silence, you lightly slap the water just to hear some noise. Reflecting oddly off the wharf above and carrying through the water, the ominous sound makes you regret breaking the silence of this cold, dark world.

Unnerved by the silence, you lightly slap the water just to hear some noise, making sure that your hearing has not been affected by the water. A snail clinging to the bottom of the wharf above your head seems to nearly match your pace through the murky water. You peer through the slats of the wharf but only occasionally see a citizen passing overhead.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Little odious bits of floating garbage occasionally bump into you as they slowly ride the river eastward. The stench assails your lungs, but total darkness mercifully spares your eyes the sight.

The delicious aroma of baking bread wafting from above tempts you to inhale deeply, but when you do the stench of decaying garbage fills your lungs instead. Apparently some of Riverhaven's citizens do not give the river its due respect. Mercifully, very little light slips through the cracks to illuminate the river and whatever else is in it.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: You lean against a piling for a moment to catch your breath, but mosquitoes as large as bees seem to home in on you and make your stay as unpleasant as possible. You look about in confusion trying to get a sense of where you are, but the darkness and the maze of pilings are daunting.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: In the nearly total darkness you bump into the remains of a piling, which once supported the wharf above but now supports only a colony of barnacles.
One of the pilings here has rotted right through, leaving a slimy wooden stalagmite that ends just inches above Faldesu's turbulent surface. Fortunately the ceiling above seems no worse for it.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Bits of fish and other undigested food floats by. Apparently you are under a tavern where the owner dumps his garbage from the day's feasting. The water barely moves here and the stench from the bloated debris only hastens your desire to move on as quickly as possible.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Your heart almost leaps out of your ribcage as a solid thump from above echoes through the wharf. You overhear grunting and more loud noises as you pause a moment, fearing that whoever is fighting above you may break through the thin planks. After a moment, the racket lessens and is followed by a hearty cheer. It sounds as if whoever bet on the winner is very pleased with the outcome.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: The sounds of crickets intermingle with your heartbeat causing it to race faster, but you're not sure why. The lapping of the river against the wharf makes a slow slurping sound as bits of plants and twigs mix with the water making it thicker and harder to move through.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Strands of cobwebs brush lightly against your face, creating goosebumps on your skin as you move about in the low light. Mumbled sounds from above do nothing to help you feel any more at ease. You feel for a solid place to put your hand to steady yourself, but almost end up cutting yourself on the badly splintered wooden pilings.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: In the darkness above, boards creak and groan under the onslaught of dozens of stomping feet. Or maybe they're dancing. Whatever it is, the few weak rays of light from a guttering lantern which leak between the planks are intermittently blocked by the moving bodies.

Your heart nearly stops as a great bearlike roar pierces the air, rivalling the cry of the World Dragon itself. But after a few moments, you realize it was merely someone snoring prodigiously in the room above. The sleeper must have shuttered his windows, for very little light reaches you through the planking.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Trace amounts of phosphorous in the river glimmer faintly, but provide far too little light to see. The sound of music and laughter trickles down from above.
The sound of music and laughter trickles down from above, as does a little light. A gap in the netting allows you to follow the river eastward.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: A glimmer of flickering torchlight shines through a knothole in the planking above. Not really enough to illuminate, it is nevertheless bright enough to ruin your night vision for a while.

A knothole in the planking above admits a narrow beam of light. Darkness would be preferable. Many of the deobar pilings supporting the wharf have eroded or been chewed away, giving the impression that the whole mess will collapse any day now. You have no desire to be underneath it when it does.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Trace amounts of phosphorous in the river glimmer faintly, but provide far too little light to see.

Someone has strung heavy fishing nets along the pilings to either side, forcing you to travel either northwest or southeast. Several carrionfish are occupied with the body of a young rivertooth entangled in one of the nets. Perhaps the netting is here to keep this watery path safe from predators.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Trace amounts of phosphorous in the river glimmer faintly, but provide far too little light to see. A syncopated plopping noise indicates water or some other liquid dripping from above.
Very little light issues from the planking above, but a steady drip does. Moving closer to it, you identify it as cheap wine, doubtless leaking from an even cheaper barrel in a warehouse above.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Trace amounts of phosphorous in the river glimmer faintly, but provide far too little light to see. You hear the swirling and gurgling of the river around you and the occasional bump or footstep from above.

Narrow rays and pinpricks of light filtering through the planks of the wharf above form an artificial night sky supported by a bewildering array of pilings. Trace amounts of phosphorous swirl madly in the river. The overall effect is quite beautiful but somewhat disorienting. One especially thick ironwood piling catches your eye.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Trace amounts of phosphorous in the river glimmer faintly, but provide far too little light to see. A little salt trickles down from above.

A few stray grains of salt and a few narrow beams of light slip between the planks of the wharf above. Where the two meet, they sparkle like fairy dust, or like Faenella's eyes -- a sharp contrast to the flotsam and junk caught between the pilings.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Trace amounts of phosphorous in the river glimmer faintly, but provide far too little light to see.

The wreckage of a small boat caught in the maze of pilings blocks further progress eastward. Other wreckage and oddments have been trapped against it by the current, including what looks like an Elven thighbone. Beneath the river's surface, your feet brush against something solid but slimy.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Feeling your way around in the dark, it quickly becomes clear that debris makes the way south impassible. Now and then a muffled giggle is audible over the gentle noise of the swirling water.
A twisted tangle of debris impedes southward movement. A tiny water beetle darts around aimlessly on the water's surface, heedless of the river's mad swirls and eddies.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: Miniature whitecaps are the river's reaction to the submerged debris it encounters on its eastward journey. They glow with what looks like moonlight but is really, according to the Lorethews, phosphorescent algae. Pretty, but you couldn't read a book by the meager light.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: A tremendous splash shatters the silence and pelts the back of your head with heavy drops. You whirl to see a smallish turtle paddling frantically away, more frightened of you than you were by its noisy dive into the river.

node.name: Riverhaven, Under Wharfs
node.description: For a brief moment your feet touch bottom. Then to your chagrin, the riverbed twitches and shifts under your feet, then swims away upriver! Strange that so large a ray could maneuver in this twisted labyrinth of pilings and submerged junk.

node.name: Dead Bird's Paradise
node.description: A massive stuffed albatross, its outstretched wings suspended from the ceiling, hovers over the heads of the denizens of this small tavern. Tables and chairs are packed together tightly, leaving just enough room for the barmaid to squeeze between as she delivers orders. The floor is sticky with spilled ale and crumbs of food, and the cheerful sound of voices raised in somewhat drunken songs echoes from the rafters.

node.name: Enfermine's Dry Goods, Showroom
node.description: Neat and tidy is the only way to describe Enfermine's shop of goods. Everything in its place and a place for everything keeps repeating in your mind. Row upon row of items needed for the traveler are stacked in good order all around you. Leaning across the counter in anticipation of a quick sale, Enfermine tries to gauge your net worth so as to receive the highest profit possible from you.

node.name: Her Opulence
node.description: Long, wide and low, this vessel is built for utility, but the hand of luxury can be discerned in the ornately carved walnut railings, down-cushioned benches and the well polished deck. Six lanterns along the ferry's rail fill the boat with a soft light, creating a feeling of closure from the surrounding blackness.

node.name: His Daring Exploit
node.description: Most of the passengers on this low riding barge have descended into quiet conversation, not wishing to stir the night. A single lantern, swinging from the fore rail, pushes its dull gold rays across the dark water.

node.name: Riverhaven, Stone Bridge
node.description: The lanes outside the eastern gate of Riverhaven are crowded with the bustle of street peddlers and merchant wagons coming and going in a great rush to sell their wares. Beggars line the paved road, aware that the more influential and wealthy folks use this gate. They hover, hands extended, hoping that a moment of kindness and charity might befall them. A stone bridge that once provided passage across the river is now little more than a crumbling stone pier used by some local fishermen.

node.name: Riverhaven, Outside North Gate
node.description: The great North Gate guards the entrance to the town of Riverhaven. Guards lounge nearby, leaning on their pikes but still managing to keep a wary eye on people passing their post. A wide road, impassable for now due to construction work, runs northwards. A dirt path wanders northeast, away from the main road.

node.name: Theren's Star, Deck
node.description: The first of the massive barges to traverse Lake Gwenalion, Theren's Star still maintains a quiet elegance despite its apparent age. The utilitarian deck upon which casual travelers walk is spartan, but the decking is made of expensive tabor wood felled from far southern forests. An oval doorway leads down to the barge's cargo bay, while an elaborately-carved wooden door provides ingress to the comfortably appointed lounge.

node.name: Bantheld's Ironworks, Salesroom
node.description: You immediately notice the stark simplicity of this armor shop. No fancy displays or signs, just a half-awake Gor'Tog sitting behind the oak counter swatting away the occasional fly. An inelegant catalog sits atop the counter waiting for your review. A large wooden door leads to the back room from whence you hear much banging and scraping.

node.name: Stone Docks, Covered Shore
node.description: Barely extending from the shore, the dock is little more than a short series of solid blocks of weather-battered stone. Thick sheets of canvas are lashed in a tent-like fashion around this port, keeping the onslaught of the skies and winds at bay while also serving to mask its presence from passing ships. With the excessive vegetation that creates yet another disguising layer outside the canvas, it's clear that many boats could pass along the Faldesu without ever knowing this place exists.

node.name: Unspiek's Repair Shop, Workroom
node.description: The sound of hammering and grinding is deafening in this cramped workshop. The heat from a small forge nearly roasts you and you try to move away from it without getting in the way of an apprentice hammering out fist-sized dents in a bloody steel cuirass. Unspiek, a squat and massive Dwarf, is filing the nicks out of a battle-axe nearly as broad as he is. Sparks shower the floor from his rapid work and the noise, on top of the rest of the infernal din, makes your teeth ache.

node.name: Seli's Armory, Sales Room
node.description: A masked figure, clad head to toe in black leather, stands alongside a scaled curtain dividing the front room from the workshop in back. Only a little light filters into the room through the drawn window shades, lending the whole room a spooky, otherworldly feel. Shadowy outlines along the walls reveal themselves on closer examination as pieces of leather armor hung for display.

node.name: Riverhaven, Dance Academy
node.description: Jeseri's dance academy consists of a single room with polished hard wood floors. Polished metal paneling provides students and teacher alike with reflected images that allows self observation. An assistant dance instructor acknowleges you with a smile then turns back to her students, continuing her patient coaching. A young elf sits quietly in the corner, awaiting his instruction to provide more music on his lute. There is a large sign that is tacked to the wall on the far end of the room.

node.name: Temple, Shadowy Chamber
node.description: A lone candle glows faintly atop a corroded slab of black stone, caked with a filthy mixture of dirt, old leaves, and wax. Its light is eerily muted, and fades into a wall of shadows which seem to press inwards with each tiny flicker of the flame. A thick moist stench assaults you, flowing in warm sickening waves from somewhere out in the blackness. Tangled roots hanging from the ceiling reach out and grab you as you make your way through the near-dark cavern, as if moved by some malicious will.

node.name: Academy, Garden
node.description: Low stone benches rest beneath the shade of a large cherry tree in full bloom. Fallen pink petals cover the ground in a sweet-smelling floral carpet. To the west stands an old brick building, which a sign proclaims is the Riverhaven Town Library. To the north and east stand newer buildings of stone set up as classrooms.

node.name: Academy, Library
node.description: A grim-faced Dwarven librarian sits behind a dusty desk piled high with papers, glowering at visitors as they come and go. Faded scrolls and pieces of parchment rest on display behind panes of protecting glass. A wooden reading table runs through the center of the room, next to a tall shelf covering one wall.

node.name: Academy, Lecture Hall
node.description: A small lectern set upon a table stands alone and exposed at the front of the room, facing rows of high-backed chairs where students sit, each waiting their turn to speak. Aside from the front podium which is flanked by 4 glowing lanterns, the room is poorly lit, with shades covering all of the windows.

node.name: Academy, Lecture Hall
node.description: Cheery, attentive students sit on polished wooden benches gazing up at an instructor jotting notes on a black slate board. The teacher is animated in his lecturing, and seems truly engrossed in his subject. Against the back wall is a banner reading Knowledge is the key to unlocking many doors.

node.name: Academy, Lecture Hall
node.description: This small room is not designed like the other lecture halls found in this academy. Here, chairs sit in small groups of three to four, with each cluster having its own professor assigned. Several discussions are taking place, while some instructors wait for students to join their group. A large slate board dominates the room and has something written on it.

node.name: Clerics' Guild, Main Entrance
node.description: A silent, masked figure stands before the tall arched doorway leading onto the street, a naked sword resting across his folded arms. A spotless red tile floor stretches between clean white walls under a tall beamed ceiling. Robed figures glide quietly by, engrossed in their private errands.

A silent, masked figure stands before the tall arched doorway leading onto the street, a naked sword resting across his folded arms. A spotless red tile floor stretches between clean white walls under a tall beamed ceiling. Robed figures glide quietly by, engrossed in their private errands.

node.name: Lybadel, Main Deck
node.description: In the middle of the ship, the main deck is closest to the water of all the open decks, and on a hard heel the waves can wash over the exposed planks. For this reason, everything is securely fastened down to keep it from sliding or being washed away, and the hatches are tightly dogged shut. Forward lies the forecastle and an oak door leading to the galley, while aft rises the quarterdeck and under it, a cabin door.

node.name: West Guard Tower, Entrance
node.description: A bored-looking city guard sits slumped over a mound of paperwork behind a simple wooden desk. Various notices are posted on the wall behind his head. To his left, an open doorway leads to a steep flight of stairs heading up to the second floor.

node.name: West Guard Tower, Barracks
node.description: Narrow cots, each with a footlocker at the end, extend into the circular room like spokes in a wheel. A trapdoor in the floor leads down to the first level, while a ladder in one corner leads up to the next. Light comes from torches lining the mortared stone walls. Two barred slit windows look out over the countryside from the western side of the wall.

node.name: Lokthal's Bakery Shop, Salesroom
node.description: You begin to salivate freely as your eyes take in the pastries and confections arranged before you. A small dwarven child rushes in and immediatly places his face against the glass of a nearby display that holds a luscious yellow and white funnel cake. Lokthal is busy mixing together ingredients for some sweet concoction and every now and then takes a lick from his fingers in glee.

node.name: Clothiers, Sales Floor
node.description: Brightly colored silk veils hang down from the ceiling above you, forming a brilliant canopy overhead. Rich velvet curtains hang from the shop's many windows, and the floor is covered in a soft thick rug. Several low tables are set about the room, piled with bolts of cloth and spools of decorative thread and ribbon.

node.name: A Touch of Comfort
node.description: This cozy shop is decorated with bright linens and cheerful paints in rich primary colors. Arranged around the room, a collection of comfortable-looking armchairs invites customers to sit down and enjoy Sereah's charming company while she demonstrates the quality of her wares and the durability of her fabrics.

node.name: Riverhaven, Traders' Guild Lobby
node.description: The lobby of the Guild is a grand place. High narrow windows of stained glass show pictures of traders bringing the benefits of civilized marketing and goods to primitive peoples in many lands and strange places. The heavy carpeting on the floor is done in patterns representing coins and monies of distant and forgotten lands. Nearby, the Guild Office handles official matters. A tall and wide doorway, gated and guarded, leads to the Trading Pit where only Traders may go to conduct their deals.

node.name: Traders' Guild, Foreign Trade Office
node.description: This office suite is the paragon of efficiency. Assistants quickly and quietly enter and leave carrying reports of the needs of neighboring provinces and what they have to offer this one. A map of the known world graces a plastered wall.

node.name: Traders' Guild, Office
node.description: The Office of the Guild handles all official matters. Promotions, joining, leaving and all internal disputes are brought here for the Master Trader to handle. A huge desk, covered with scrolls and tally-sheets and rosters occupies the center of the room. An equally massive safe sits nearby, holding secure the finances of this branch.

node.name: Traders' Guild, Upper Hallway
node.description: This hallway leads to the Guild library and to a small lounge overlooking the Trading Pit. Walls painted a soft blue harmonize with pale gold carpeting. The frenzied atmosphere below is much reduced here. A few apprentices lounge about talking quietly among themselves or reading scrolls from the library.

node.name: Traders' Guild, Library
node.description: Thick carpeting and heavy drapes muffle outside noises to keep the library a peaceful place. A shelf of books and racks of scrolls are here for the edification of young Guild members and even the general public. A low table with several chairs awaits the eager scholar. A sharp-eyed librarian keeps a watchful eye on the room lest rare books or scrolls leave unbidden.

node.name: Traders' Guild, Upper Lounge
node.description: This quiet lounge overlooks the bustling Trading Pit. Large windows, with thick panes of glass, prevent the clamorous din of buying and selling from making its way here and keep any non-guild member from possibly overhearing any private conversations or learning any guild secrets. Couches lined up along the walls allow observation of the chaos below in comfort.

node.name: Traders' Guild, Upper Hallway
node.description: Polished brass sconces with lit white candles line the wide hallway. Colorfully patterned rugs line the polished mahogany floors, practically laid not only to add dimension to the room, but also to mute the sound of scores of feet that enter the busy corridor. A hand-carved mahogany entrance stands open to welcome guests into the auction hall foyer, while on the opposite end a large brass-hinged door marks the way to the banquet hall.

node.name: Anzu ia Bima, Reservations
node.description: Framed chalk sketches and paintings line the walls of the small office, displaying party rooms filled with guests in some, and others displaying food and drink presentations. Comfortable chairs sit in front of a fine birch desk, where guests may sit to discuss their plans with the reservation clerk.

node.name: Traders' Guild, Auction Foyer
node.description: Auctioneers, bidders, and spectators alike make their way back and forth through the open eggshell white doors that lead into the Auction Hall. A lovely marble statue of a young, beautiful serving girl stands between the doors, her head turned ever so slightly to the side and her eyes lidded to display an almost dreamy, far-off look. Her arms are stretched out before her with her hands together and fingers curved up, delicately holding a silver tray.

node.name: Traders' Guild, Auction Hall
node.description: Prospective buyers hover near a fine parchment that hangs almost reverently in finished brass clasps along the back wall of the room, hoping to get an idea of what homeless treasures will soon grace the auction stand. Offsetting the smooth, eggshell white walls and ceiling is carved crown molding, finished with fine gold leaf that glistens in the light of the ironwork chandelier above. Below, long wooden benches with horsehair seats are placed before the long table where the items for bid are displayed.

node.name: Town Hall Lobby
node.description: The entrance to the town's civil nerve center is simple and businesslike. Pale grey stone floor and white-washed walls allow little in the way of decor, but are functional. Opposite the main entrance is the Licensing and Debt Office where citizens handle matters of taxation, fines and public debts owed. A sweeping staircase leads to the upper floor.

node.name: Town Hall, Upper Landing
node.description: The decor here is somewhat more elaborate than the utilitarian mode of the ground floor. The office of the Mayor and the Hall of Public Assembly bring the great and powerful to gather. The walls, washed a soft cream, are hung with paintings of past mayors, each wearing a suitably aloof expression. A glass case to one side holds a large ship's model.

node.name: Town Hall, Hall of Public Assembly
node.description: This hall is designed to hold the major portion of the town's gentry for important meetings. Padded benches form long curved rows facing a raised speaker's platform. The decor is subdued but elegant, with figured walnut and dark burgundy velvet hangings as the major features. Only one odd note mars the sober and reserved scene, a painting on one wall seems oddly out of place.

node.name: Town Hall, Mayor's Office
node.description: This office defines luxury. The walls are covered in tooled leather and burled flamewood. A huge desk of tiger-striped oak dominates the room. High-backed chairs of soft-cushioned leather await the lordlings of the city.

node.name: Town Hall, Debt Office
node.description: Depressingly like any office anywhere in all the realms you have travelled, this one is obviously where people come to part with money that someone else thinks they can spend more wisely. A bored clerk behind a worn counter patiently answers questions and takes payments from all comers. The floor, once a soft grey, has been scuffed and rubbed into a dingy mud color that no scrubbing will ever alleviate.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Courtyard
node.description: The Inn rises above you on three sides. Stone and half-timber work make a pleasing sight and the place radiates charm and comfort. A sizable stable at the back of the courtyard accomodates travelers' horses and carriages. One wing houses the kitchens, butteries and storerooms for the ever-full dining and drinking rooms. A wide-open door beckons you into the dark interior where laughter and the scent of good food emanate.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Foyer
node.description: Polished oak and silverwood parquet floors glitter with the soft light of many candles. Walls of quarrystone might look chill and formal elsewhere, but not here, for embroidered rugs and silken tapestries adorn every wall. Truly, this is a place that knows how to make you welcome. A small kiosk to one side for the convenience of arriving guests checking in stands ready, along with a cloakroom for storing of heavy gear.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Quiet Bar
node.description: This small, quiet room is warm and cozy. Resembling the parlor of a prosperous house more than a bar, it exudes comfort and serene enjoyment. A large fireplace holds a cheery blaze filling the room with warmth. Fragrant fruitwood smoke scents the air. Leather couches and chairs gather around small tables for the comfort of guests. A small service counter offers an array of drinks and food to match the ambiance.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Main Hall
node.description: The lavish main hall of the Inn dazzles one with the richness of its decor. Fumed oak and dark leather cover the walls and a decorated ceiling of hammered tin form the cup into which the elite and powerful in this town pour out their gold and silver in return for lavish food and drink. A constant low hum of talk and whispered confidences fill the air. Small groups huddle around their tables, no doubt making deals that will affect trade across the province and well into others.

The lavish main hall of the Inn dazzles one with the richness of its decor. Fumed oak and dark leather cover the walls and a decorated ceiling of hammered tin form the cup into which the elite and powerful in this town pour out their gold and silver in return for lavish food and drink. A constant low hum of talk and whispered confidences fill the air, some drifting in from the nearby bar. Small groups huddle around their tables, no doubt making deals that will affect trade across the province and well into others.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Shadowy Corner
node.description: The bright lights of the main room fail to penetrate to this far corner. The shadows are thick and heavy. A few small candles glimmer on scattered tables, but their glow is limited to a few feet. Dark shapes huddle over drinks and talk in low voices, anxious not to be overheard. Scattered pairs and groups of people maintain a discreet distance from one another.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Quiet Corner
node.description: This quiet corner of the main bar seems to be insulated from the noise and babble elsewhere. Heavy velvet hangings on the walls and thick carpets account for much of the quietude. Silver and crystal sconces shed a warm light and a low settee offers respite for tired feet.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Large Table
node.description: A large circular table that can seat many people stands beneath an elaborate chandelier of crystal and bronze. Comfortable chairs ring the table, ready for patrons' use. The seal of the town has been worked into the table in a delicate inlay and you suspect that much of the town's business gets done here.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Kiosk
node.description: The kiosk is set to one side of the busy foyer so that guests may come and go with a minimum of fuss and bother. An antique bronze counter inset with soft wine-colored velvet serves as desk for the dignified Elothean behind it. A nearby stair climbs to the upper stories. Overhead, a wrought iron candelabra sheds a warm glow over all.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Stair Landing
node.description: A wide hallway leads to the north, where several private salons for entertaining reside. Thick carpets warm the cold stone floor and elegant wall-hangings depict scenes of revelry and banqueting.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Upper Hall
node.description: A number of doors to either side of the passage mark rooms set aside for patrons desiring privacy from the noise and tumult of the main room below. At the far south end of the hallway stands a circular staircase, its wooden steps extending from ceiling to floor, and beyond.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Sunset Room
node.description: Facing west, this room captures the sunset each evening through large floor-to-ceiling doors that open onto a private patio. A small fireplace opposite these features a magnificent painting of a twilight ocean under a silver moon hung above the mantel. A modest table set with silver candlesticks on a white linen cloth awaits the next dinner party.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Second Floor Balcony
node.description: A wide balcony opens out from the Sunset Room on the Inn's second floor. Facing west to capture the evening's last light, the balcony looks out over the town below. Bronze lanterns set high overhead and along the low railing wait the coming of night to add their soft radiance to the stars above.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Sunrise Room
node.description: Facing east to greet the morning sun, this room is done in merry tones of gold and blue to reflect the cheery orb of morning as it rises high in a cloudless sky. Pale yellow table cloths set with bright polished silver decorate small white tables scattered about the room. Few, save the weariest slug-a-bed, would begrudge breakfast here.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Traders' Lounge
node.description: Set with heavy leather-covered chairs and couches, this large room is normally reserved for the Traders of the town. To ease the stress of their fevered profession, gatherers here are forbidden to discuss any aspect of Trade and commerce. Meant as a refuge from their daily cares, the room is comfortable and a bit stodgy, like an old uncle.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Cloakroom
node.description: Many shelves line the walls, allowing gear and garments to be stored easily. Hooks for cloaks and hats line one wall and not a few walking sticks are propped here and there. There is a small stool for the attendant and a tiny table.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Third Floor Landing
node.description: This floor holds the bedrooms available for guests. Newly picked rushes cover the flagstone floor and ewers of water and bowls and towels for washing are arrayed on tables at the head of the stairs. A skylight overhead lets in a slight breeze from off the river and the air is full of the smell of clean sheets and fresh linens.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Hallway
node.description: Bedrooms open off both sides of the hallway. To the south, the great circular stairway leads down to the lower floors. Each door has a small table next to it with a good supply of candles and such for each guest's need.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Hallway
node.description: White-washed wall and clean stone floors continue down this hallway. Skylights overhead allow a goodly amount of light into the passage.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Owner's Suite
node.description: This room, the grandest of the Inn, is done in a nautical style. Resembling an elegant ship's stateroom, the furnishings would do a great sailing vessel proud. The lamps are on gimbals and the dining table swings down from the wall for use. A large double bed is set within a niche in the far wall complete with leeboards to keep the guests from falling out. Paintings of various maritime themes complete the effect.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Roof Garden
node.description: Concealing the roof of the inn is a tiny but lovely garden filled with flowers and low shrubs. A waterfall set among ferns and lillies empties into a tiny pond complete with fish. Hedges rise along the perimeter to block out the view of the town and give a secluded feel to this spot of greenery. Birds sing in the dwarf trees scattered among the shrubs along a pebbled walkway.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Moon Mage Tent
node.description: Large piles of musty leather tomes, yellowed star charts, and assorted brass instruments lie strewn about in a haphazard mess under the brown canvas of this tent. Although the equipment would seem to indicate a place of learning, your first impression is more that of a refugee camp, and a disorganized one at that.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Dormitory
node.description: Unlike the elegant rooms elsewhere, this room is meant for the more penurious traveller or those who simply do not care to toss around their coins. Comfortable but simple bunks, two high, line both sides of the room. A long table down the center holds washbasins and pitchers at the ready and a small privy at the far end of the room handles the necessities of nature.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Blue Room
node.description: Done entirely in shades of blue, this room feels cool and soft. Sky blue curtains filter the light of day into a soft and relaxing color. A four-poster bed set with a great counterpane the color of a sparkling twilight sky beckons the weary guest. A pair of comfortable chairs sit alongside a small dining table in one corner. A small iron stove, set with pale blue tiles provides a gentle warmth against the chill of night or inclement weather.

node.name: Pierless Inn, Scarlet Room
node.description: This bedroom, done in flame and scarlet, sets the blood to dancing and the senses awakening with the intensity of the colors. Velvet wall coverings in a fiery red turn the cool light of day into the heated fires of a gypsy camp. Even the bedspread is a deep and rich crimson, like scattered rubies beneath the heel of a conqueror, glittering in the soft white embrace of the sheets beneath.

node.name: East Guard Tower, Ingress
node.description: Staring upwards, you are unable to see the top of the tower from your current vantage point. The walls are made of strong ironwood timbers reinforced with iron strappings. Musky odors cling to the wood from repeated assaults by the river below. A well built set of stairs ascends into the darkness far above. To the south you see a door leading to the rivergate controls which is securely locked and guarded by two burly Gor'Togs.

node.name: East Guard Tower, Second Floor
node.description: You stand on the first stratum of the tower. Small rectangular windows that serve as arrow slits for the bowmen of Riverhaven completely surround you. Frequently the breeze blows through the slits to rustle the many small flags that are done in the shades of Riverhaven's military colors. A wooden bucket to hold water for the parched archers sits nearby. Stairs lead down to the ingress while a wooden ladder leads up.

node.name: East Guard Tower, Third Floor
node.description: A few tall thin windows that allow one to survey the countryside are interspersed amongst the arrow slits. Looking down you instinctively hug the rough wooden walls for fear of falling. A rope swaying from the landing above seems to be the only way to gain entrance to the lookout.

node.name: East Guard Tower, Lookout
node.description: Gazing from the top of this lofty tower, all of Riverhaven is displayed before you. To the north, far away, palisade walls nestle into the low mountains. A breeze brings smells and sounds from the warehouse district directly below. Peering over the side, you see the river rushing by below. From this height you are unable to hear its sounds but the moisture of the river still makes its way up.

node.name: West Guard Tower, Armory
node.description: This is the tower's armory and storage room. The walls are hung with swords, shields, pikes and all manner of weaponry, and the floors are stacked with boxes of crossbow bolts, arrows, and crates of food and supplies. The outer wall of the tower forms a neat semi-circle, with a wooden partition dividing this floor of the tower in half.

node.name: West Guard Tower, Officers Quarters
node.description: This room looks to be a barracks for officers in the town guard. A wide barred window in the western wall looks out over the countryside surrounding the town of Riverhaven. Maps, reports, and requisitions cover a large table set under the window, opposite two comfortable beds flanking the doorway to the next room.

node.name: West Guard Tower, Roof
node.description: From the top of the guardtower, you can peer through slits in the stone wall to look out over the town and the surrounding countryside. A raised platform in the center of the tower supports a hinged pole, which looks like it might be a mounting for a ballista. A tarp is strung across four poles to one side of the area, to provide some shelter against the weather for the guards constantly stationed here.

node.name: Town Jail, Judgement Chamber
node.description: Long benches fill this simple room. A large desk and two chairs set facing out on a two foot wood riser. Alone in the corner is an iron barred cage, no doubt the holding area for the accused. Railed platforms on opposite walls provide the place for the town's barristers to spin their yarns in an effort to persuade the sitting judge.

node.name: City Togs, Storeroom
node.description: Padded mannequins, shrouded in cheesecloth to keep off the dust, stand in the center of the storeroom. The fabric is pulled back to reveal bridal outfits. Boxes and trunks lie in neat piles around it, holding assorted garments not currently on display in the main salesroom.

node.name: Riverhaven, Northeast Guard Post
node.description: Little more than a wooden plank a couple of feet wide, this lookout serves as a backup position for the main guard towers. A narrow little ladder leads back down to the street far below. Gazing out, you see the flat fields and marshy areas around town and the small plots of farmland being plowed. Far to the north, a range of low hills can just be made out.

node.name: Noble Inn, Foyer
node.description: Bright shimmering light streams down from a huge chandelier hung from the polished maple beams in the ceiling. Cloth of gold drapes the tall arched windows facing the street. A broad staircase of pink marble leads to the second floor, flanked on one side by a tall columned archway leading to the dining room, and on the other by the ornately carved desk of the inn's registry.

node.name: Noble Inn, Stables
node.description: The inn's vast stables are so elegantly appointed that the word 'luxurious' is not out of place here. The tall arched ceiling is made of stone, and decorated with colorful inlaid tiles. A raised brick walkway runs between twin lines of wooden stalls. Each stall has its own marble waterbasin, fed by bronze spigots set into the wall. A few horses clustered together in one corner are the only beneficiaries of this opulent home.

node.name: Noble Inn, Hallway
node.description: A red and gold patterned carpet runs along the center of the polished wood panel floor, past rows of doors leading to private rooms for the guests. Matching tapestries, depicting a parade of well dressed men and women being led up to a glittering golden throne, cover the walls between the doorways.

node.name: Noble Inn, Hallway
node.description: The hallway runs past openings leading into private suites, towards an open double door flanked with stained wooden columns. Vases of fresh flowers rest on marble tables set near the entrance to each room.

node.name: Noble Inn, Hallway
node.description: Rows of doors line the hallway flanked by decorative spiral-carved wooden pillars. Between the doors, shallow nooks in the walls display a collection of porcelain vases and statuary. A red and gold patterned carpet runs along the length of the hall, soft and yielding underfoot.

node.name: Noble Inn, Hallway
node.description: Shallow nooks in the walls display a collection of porcelain vases and statuary. At the end of the hall, a black ironwood door stands open, flanked by marble-topped plant stands. A sign on the door identifies this as the headquarters for the local representative of the Paladin's Guild.

node.name: Noble Inn, Green Room
node.description: A bronze bowl filled with cedar chips sits upon the hearth, the heat of the fire releasing the fragrant oils to fill the room with the scent of the forest. Green damask curtains sway gently in the breeze through the open window. A copperleaf sleigh bed juts out from the wall at an angle, its feather mattress covered by fine linen sheets and lace-trimmed pillows. On the other side of the door, a fern sways in a knotted hanger over a round table.

node.name: Noble Inn, Crimson Room
node.description: A cast iron bed features lacy basketwork finials topping the four tall posts and crimson velvet draperies pulled back with heavy silver silk tassels. Nearby, a vase of fragrant white orange blossoms rests on a glass-topped filigree cast iron table. The whitewashed walls and exposed dark oak beams make the room appear larger than it really is.

node.name: Noble Inn, Dining Hall
node.description: A long banquet table runs across the center of the room, flanked on each side by padded benches upholstered in delicate embroidered silk. Smaller round dining tables sit in private nooks in the walls, next to tall brass candelabra which shine with a low flickering light. A low murmur of conversation carries from parties of guests seated about the area. The walls are hung with tapestries matching the embroidered burgundy rug covering the floor.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Dry Creek Lane
node.description: The din of the city is muffled by magnificent magnolia trees that line the wide lane. A brick path greets a small bridge that leads toward a small community of well-kept homes and tended gardens.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Dry Creek Bridge
node.description: White painted wood creates this small bridge that arches over an ornamental creek bed. Towering magnolia trees shade the sloping, mossy banks with their large white blossoms. Folks heading to and from their homes stop momentarily to chat a while before continuing on their way.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Blossom Circle
node.description: Matching the owner's home with every shutter and shingle, a birdfeeder stands atop a thick pole in the center of the yard to welcome feather-winged boarders. Sweet smelling jasmine twines its way around the shaft and over the roof, one major digression from the original design. Lush green moss creates an abstract tiling as it creeps around the white cobblestones of the road.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Blossom Circle
node.description: The dark purple blossoms of wood violets encircle a few tree trunks, lending a splash of color to the dull brown. Residents stroll casually beneath the shady branches of magnolia trees along the cobblestone lane. Fresh and inviting, the surroundings provide aesthetic scenery while venturing to the casual gathering spot in the middle of the circle.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Blossom Circle
node.description: Flower boxes adorn several verandas in the neighborhood, filling the area with a glorious rainbow colors and fragrance. A pair of white wicker chairs rock lazily in the breeze on one porch, while a pitcher of lemonade on a nearby table waits patiently to quench a thirst. Soft, cheery music drifts into the lane from an open window.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Blossom Circle
node.description: Intermittent gusts of wind cause showers of velvety petals to descend upon the cobblestone path from the trees on either side. The white droppings collect near a terracotta pot turned over on its side, decorating the lawn of a nearby house. A wild mess of flower tendrils spills from the interior, spiraling up and over the rim to threaten total domination over the grass.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Commons
node.description: Dozens of magnolia trees with evergreen leaves border the park, rendering shadows at all points of the day. Narrow pathways lined with perfectly-shaped gardenia bushes frame the manicured lawn. White iron benches form a circle in the center of the commons, allowing a restful pause away from the hurried bustle.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Blossom Circle
node.description: The cobblestone lane sashays around a central tree-lined park, allowing a pleasant view from all the surrounding homes. A pie cools on an open window sill, its aroma of baked apples and cinnamon creating a mouth-watering temptation on the breeze. Tall bear's breeches are dominant in one of the gardens, and their dark green heart-shaped leaves form spiky hems around the white and purple flowers.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Blossom Circle
node.description: Homes with large front porches and gabled rooftops surround the recreational area to the southeast, many dangling baskets of light pink begonias from their eaves. Hanging from a tall oak tree, a wooden swing is decorated with brightly colored pillows. Warbling avian melodies fill the area with just enough sound to enhance the natural ambiance.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Blossom Circle
node.description: A raised box of growing herbs and vegetables sits near a kitchen doorway of one of the homes. Dressed in top hat and waistcoat, a scarecrow looks more inviting than fearful as it stands sentinel over the garden. Occasionally, the aroma of roasted chicken wafts into the area from just around the bend.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Blossom Circle
node.description: The cobblestone lane continues along uninterrupted, appearing freshly pruned of intrusive weeds. Ivy makes a sport of climbing on several buildings in the area, clinging tenaciously to chimneys and walls. Frilly eyelet curtains are visible inside one window, accenting the dark purple verbena growing in a faded flower box.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Blossom Circle
node.description: Nature abounds here despite the close proximity to the urban landscape beyond the trees. Boxwood hedges blend with the magnolias to border the cobblestone lane, offering some semblance of privacy for the residents. Light floral scents float on a lingering breeze, occasionally mixed with a dose fresh river air.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Blossom Circle
node.description: Tones of conversation from the commons to the northeast flavor the atmosphere along with a few select notes from passing songbirds. The magnolia trees droop favorably over the homes, casting them in curtains of green leaves and vibrant blooms. It is almost hard to believe that the rough city streets lie just beyond the foliage.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Blossom Circle
node.description: One particularly large tree rests in the middle of the path, forcing the pavers to split the line of cobble in two to accommodate the trunk's breadth. Laden with pristine white blossoms, the magnolia's branches extend far over the rooftops of several nearby houses. Local birds twitter noisily above, concealed by the leaves.

node.name: Dunkard's Tavern
node.description: Students gather in small groups, some poring over their books as they drink, and others clustered around the dartboard on the back wall. The wine is weak, the beer somewhat flat, but the tavern's cheap prices and dim lighting combine to ensure a brisk business despite the shortcomings of the food and drink.

node.name: Riverhaven, Ioun's Pawn
node.description: Nothing in your lifetime has prepared you for the clutter you encounter in this shop. Not a single hint of organization meets the eye. Looking behind the counter you see an assortment of items that span the gamut from antique to brand new. Dust is so thick on some of the older items that it is difficult to make out any color. You kick yourself a path to the counter and are startled by Ioun, the shop owner, who was hidden by a stack of items on the counter.

node.name: Zanthron's Artificer Shop, Salesroom
node.description: You flinch as you feel slight shocks of static running up your arm while standing in Zanthron's shop. A purple and black tapestry hangs in the back of the shop while glass display cases of miniature animals sit on shelves arranged haphazardly on another wall. Zanthron herself sits on a stool behind the counter scowling at a runestone and muttering arcane phrases as if looking for an opening in the stone.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Alleyway
node.description: Stacks of boxes flank the passage, likely left by hired hands after delivering produce and other foodstuffs to the neighborhood residents. Local street artists have painted murals upon the building walls, the images roughly styled and exhibiting a raw realism. Though the brick lining the alley is cracked, the area seems well-maintained albeit a bit cluttered.

node.name: Magnolia Corner, Alleyway
node.description: Relatively clean and lacking any overly foul odor, the path weaves between city buildings to facilitate access to the cozy community nestled discreetly amidst Riverhaven's urban landscape. Vigorous weeds have intruded between several of the bricks, and a tall boxwood hedge blocks most of the view beyond the wooden gate.

node.name: Fine Leaf's End, Sales Room
node.description: A rush of pungent tobacco fumes greets patrons upon entering the Fine Leaf. This enormous amount of smoke is created by the numerous half-pint customers trying out new blends, but the most proficient creator of the dense haze is the proprietor, Beeanna Donee, who is never without her long walnut pipe.

node.name: Riverhaven, Halfling Quarter
node.description: Covered with tiny footprints, this small alley runs behind Noot's Teahouse. Unused and hidden from the main street, this site is a perfect locale for a youth's first smoke or to sleep off a drunk.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Patron's Lounge
node.description: A dozen flambeaus cast pools of light across the malachite tile of the floor. The style and decor of the lounge offers comfort for the bard and sufficient pretentiousness to impress the potential client. Leather chairs sit ready to coddle rich bodies while inlaid tables snuggle nearby to insure that elegant manicures don't strain to reach glasses of port. Surrounded on two sides by a screen carved from scented woods, each chair sits facing a long-legged stool and matching music stand.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Rehearsal Room
node.description: Barely larger than a closet, the wood-paneled room provides a place for bards to warm up before tackling the more imposing atmosphere of the performance hall. Only a music stand is in the middle of the otherwise empty floor.

node.name: Blind Alley, Corner Slip
node.description: If this narrow passageway and its equally slender opening onto the alley were originally intended to provide an escape route in the event of fire, Damaris help those caught off guard in the servants' quarters and wayfarers' shanties which form the cluttered and cramped area nicknamed the Rookery. Only rats can run through here more than two abreast.

node.name: The Rookery, Drekkhet's Prowl
node.description: Barely a scrap of sky can be seen above what appears to be a tottering pile of randomly arranged building parts, so cramped and crowded is the Rookery. Uglier still than the unkempt facades they present to Crescent Way and neighboring thoroughfares, the back ends of Riverhaven's buildings in this quarter are graceless and functional, much like the many workaday dwellings which have sprung up in their shadows.

Two reed torches struggle to illuminate the entrance to the Rookery. The poverty of their effort suggests the half-light is intended not so much to welcome visitors, rather to aid a watchful eye in identifying them or appraising their belongings, depending on the nature of their business here at this time of night.

node.name: The Rookery, Drekkhet's Prowl
node.description: The alley widens into a narrow lane lined with coarse structures which crouch up against the backs of the larger streetfront buildings. Many of the squat huts and shacks appear fairly well-established and even passably maintained, but most ordinary folk are ill-at-ease here and move on as soon as their circumstances permit. A restless sense of impermanence prevails.

Numerous small homes give out little light from around the edges of their doors, but the darkness is still impenetrable. A curtain twitches occasionally as if by some invisible hand alerted almost instinctively to the presence of a passer-by.

node.name: The Rookery, Drekkhet's Prowl
node.description: A ragged lean-to teeters against the back wall of Natron's Workyard, a yellowing ivy creeping around the ill-fitting door of the abode and poking inquisitive tendrils into the cracks in its roof. A large clump of weeds has sprung up at the side of the lane, thriving in an open gutter which draws away the used washing-water and other refuse thrown from the upper windows of the taller buildings.

An overgrown clump of weeds lurks in the shadows at the side of the road, its lengthy tendrils reaching out to catch on clothing and startle unsuspecting visitors. The smell of salt is particularly strong here, due in large part to Natron's Workyard and the scatterings of his product which slip under the boundary fence.

node.name: The Rookery, Drekkhet's Prowl
node.description: The lane closes in a dead end of tawdry tradesmen's entrances. Several large trash containers lean against one wall, strewing sodden bags and empty food wrappers all over the beginnings of a deeply rutted dirt path which leads off to the west. The town's refuse collectors are clearly among those people who avoid the area as much as possible.

During the hours of darkness, several overfilled trash containers sprawl their contents yet further across the path as cats and rats and all manner of beggared beasts seek out a meal amidst the day's refuse. Occasional loud squeaks and yowls of displeasure echo around the area as the scavengers fight for the best pickings.

node.name: The Rookery, Dogleg Lane
node.description: The impacted dirt pathway is treacherously pot-holed and as hard as stone underfoot. Over the years, heavy rains and hot sun have petrified the deep ruts formed by heavily-laden handcarts passing this way under cover of darkness, their burdens of contraband moving silently through the side streets leading up from the docks, onward bound to unknown destinations in Riverhaven and beyond.

The treacherous pot-holes underfoot make the dirt pathway dangerous for anyone not completely familiar with the area. Many an uttered curse has fouled the air here as nightblind pedestrians stumble and sprain an ankle in their haste to depart the Rookery in one piece and without a knife between their shoulderblades.

node.name: The Rookery, Dogleg Lane
node.description: Despite the efforts of some residents to brighten their surroundings with a splash of paint or a scrap of colored fabric hanging in a window, the area's silent and perilous nightly business overpowers the atmosphere with breathless suspense and no small measure of prickling fear. Upon closer inspection, even the most meager dwelling has a sturdy lock on its door.

Residents tend to keep their homes under lock and key at all times in this dangerous neighborhood, but at dusk many even go so far as to board up their windows from the inside. For those uninvolved in the nightly industry of the Rookery, even catching a glimpse of any nocturnal deal-making can be a risky business.

node.name: The Rookery, Dogleg Lane
node.description: Heaped in a corner, a tangled fishing net buzzes with flies and festers with the nauseating stench of rotting fish. When it was first dumped here, a steady trickle of brackish water dripped off it and pooled into what is now a sticky brown stain in the dirt. At least, the circumstances suggest it's a pool of water, but in the Rookery any stain on the ground could just as easily be blood.

node.name: The Rookery, Dogleg Corner
node.description: This corner of the Rookery is particularly dank and unwelcoming. The buildings crowd together in such a way as to prevent any breeze from blowing through and clearing out the moist mustiness from the air. Various mosses and lichens thrive in a spreading green belt at the base of every wall here, using the rising damp to their best advantage.

node.name: The Rookery, Gristle Grove
node.description: Stacked in a corner, a selection of rusty handcarts and rickety wheelbarrows leans up against a wall, surrounded by old tobacco ashes and a few scattered food wrappers. A coil of heavy jute rope hangs on an iron hook nailed to the side wall of a locked wooden shack. Beneath it, a pile of neatly-folded but grimy hessian tarps awaits usage during the night.

Silent figures move to and fro, pulling handcarts and wheelbarrows from a stack against one wall. The dim glow of a pipe bobs back and forth, its tiny light and the occasional wisp of foul-smelling smoke the only clue that a real being is here, working to coordinate the concealed influx of contraband and the intermittent visits by contacts coming to collect their illicit wares.

node.name: The Rookery, Gristle Grove
node.description: Someone has thoughtfully placed a few old benches in a tight semi-circle at the foot of the tallest warehouse in the area. This is the one spot in the Rookery which receives any direct sunlight, and for those residents who are out and about during the day, it makes a reasonable place to sit and discuss clandestine transactions or quietly make arrangements for the next night's activities.

A few reed torches glow dimly around some wooden benches, giving off just enough light to see the faces and clothing of others in the area. Long shadows jump and flicker uneasily every time a slight breeze blows, and with the stealthy movement of wayfarers passing through the area.

node.name: The Rookery, Lookout Tower
node.description: From this vantage point on top of the tallest warehouse, the Riverhaven Docks can be viewed without obstruction through a narrow gap between two rooftops. To the west, the Town Hall and the Temple rise grandly above other edifices around the Square, while to the east the roof of the Mausoleum peeks above its vanguard of trees. In the far distance, a glimpse of Lake Gwenalion glitters against the rustic blue-grey shoreline of Langenfirth.

Perched high above the rooftops of Riverhaven, the night-time view from the lookout tower is magnificent. The bobbing lights of the ferries and barges slowly traverse the still black water toward Langenfirth, a glimmering golden band in the far distance. Silhouetted against the sky, the hunched black expanse of the Journalai Mountains hugs the horizon.

node.name: Riverhaven Hospital, Entrance Hall
node.description: You stand in the entrance hall of Riverhaven's famed hospital. Tall sea-green marble columns reach from the floor to the ceiling. Moss-stuffed pillows line one wall for the minor wounded to sit in while waiting for the empaths to finish with the more seriously impaired. Beneath your feet, a woven rug of soft fleece adorns the room. To the east, a cream colored arch with the words, For Their Pain, My Heart inscribed on it, beckons those who need immediate tending.

node.name: Riverhaven Hospital, Tending Chamber
node.description: An empath glances at you while scurrying over to help a wounded citizen. All around you are wounded or dying from every walk of life, but the efficiency of the empaths keeps everyone calm and assured. The smooth cream-colored marbled walls lend a cool feel to the room, helping to keep down any fevers that may afflict the diseased or poisoned. Peering through a small arch you see a glimpse of a garden outside.

node.name: Riverhaven Hospital, Garden
node.description: The smell of herbs is strong in this small but well-kept garden. Numerous herbal flower beds are laid out in rows holding Balm, Chickweed, Fenugreek, Basil and more. An empath helps an elderly female dwarf slowly around the garden, all the while chanting softly to help ease the senior dwarf's old age ills.

node.name: House of Bardic Blues, Baubles and Bits
node.description: Candlelight dances off of trinkets and spangles that are on casual display about the small room. Jewelry pieces rest on silk pillows and silk-covered stands with seemingly cavalier disregard for their safekeeping. More broadcloth hangs from the ceiling and walls in a shade of blue that's a bit lighter than the cloth in the Den. Sparkling jewels, sewn into the heavy fabric, create a spectacular kaleidoscope of reflecting shades of blue as the candlelight caresses them.

node.name: House of Bardic Blues, Secluded Courtyard
node.description: This partially covered courtyard is pungent with the smells of savory spices and incense. Exotic plants and flowers thrive here, creating an oasis away from the city's bustle and noise. Filmy blue fabric falls from the latticework overhead, cloaking the courtyard from outside view and creating a cozy, shrouded ambiance. Tall ironwork tables stand close to one another, providing stable and attractive places to enjoy a light repast. A roped-off stairway leads up to the next level of the building.

node.name: Riverhaven, Warehouse
node.description: From the dust-free stone slabs that make up the floor to the neat stacks of clearly-marked barrels and crates towering high over your head, this building is absolutely immaculate. The high ceiling with its many skylights gives the modest warehouse a feeling of wide open space. However, the strong fishy odor detracts from one's appreciation of the architecture.

node.name: Riverhaven, Warehouse
node.description: A sturdy wagon, heavily laden with large sacks of feed, rests here facing a pair of oversized doors in the north wall. A stack of pallets rests beside a lunat office door to the east. Even those are painted white, free of splinters and stains, and stacked with obsessive precision.

node.name: Riverhaven, Warehouse
node.description: Massive iron ingots are piled in the corner, and a great gouge in the stone floor shows where one was dropped. Rope lies neatly coiled alongside boxes of pulleys and winches, atop a stack of lumber. To the east, an intimidating wall of crates rises nearly to the ceiling, taking up a large portion of the building's floor space.

node.name: Riverhaven, Warehouse Office
node.description: This spacious office is as tidy as the rest of the warehouse. The odor of fish is effectively masked by sweet glaysker incense. The chairs for Suanealaena's clients are quite comfortable-looking, and her own a veritable throne of commercial power. A landscape by Dochaval adorns the rear wall.

node.name: Riverhaven, Warehouse
node.description: You are precariously perched atop a wall of crates tall enough you can almost reach the building's solid-looking deobar rafters. Below you on the east side, shadows gather in a corner concealed from the rest of the warehouse. A knotted rope hangs from the rafters, out of your reach.

node.name: Back of Warehouse
node.description: A high stack of crates separates this hidden corner from the rest of the warehouse, while a few more crates serve as crude tables and chairs. A knotted rope dangles from the rafters above, swinging slightly.

node.name: Riverhaven, Mansion Gate
node.description: A tall wrought-iron gate stands between walls of crystal-flecked granite. Beyond rises a slate-roofed manse of some size, dominated by a single turret that sprouts from the gabled roof.

node.name: Riverhaven, Armiger's Mansion Grounds
node.description: Dark green hedges, sculpted into geometric patterns with loving care, guide the eye along a pathway of brightly colored crushed stone that runs from the stately mansion and the equally stately gate.

node.name: Riverhaven, Armiger's Mansion Porch
node.description: Overhanging eaves provide a cool shade along the front of the manor. A nearby lounge swing, set with soft velvet cushions, invites one to sit and enjoy the rich green gardens. A pair of ornately carved ironwood doors flanked by stained-glass windows lead into the house proper.

node.name: Armiger's Mansion, Foyer
node.description: Hexagonal tiles set in bands of alternating gold and azure form the floor in this elegantly decorated foyer. To one side is the comfortable lounge, with food and drink. A sun parlor matches it on the opposite side of the hall. A large hall tree holds the cloaks and other garments of visiting members.

node.name: Armiger's Mansion, Members' Lounge
node.description: Flamewood panels cover the lower half of the walls in this delightfully decadent lounge. Above a gilded chair rail, the upper walls are hung with heavy tapestries interset with heroic paintings. Numerous low tables and soft settees and chairs abound in cozy groups for conversation or just plain relaxation. An elaborate sideboard holds a cornucopia of refreshments. Tall floor to ceiling windows look out onto a side garden where a fountain dances, silver drops of water sparkling as they fall.

node.name: Armiger's Mansion, Teller Windows
node.description: Deep emerald green floor tiles, gleaming oak walls and polished railings glow under the light of a dozen shaded oil lamps. Patient clerks, standing behind the brass bars of the teller windows, murmur quietly to bank patrons, each word accentuated by the quiet clink of coins being tallied for deposit or withdrawal. A pair of grim-faced guards flank the entrance, watching both clerks and customers with the same alert gaze, their presence giving palpable notice that naught will happen on their watch.

node.name: Armiger's Mansion, Sun Parlor
node.description: Enclosed on three sides in crystalline glass, the room seems to merge into the gardens outside. Potted plants and cunningly pruned flowering vines cover the walls and most surfaces. Wicker furniture set with floral-patterned cushions ranges about the room, no one piece blocking the relaxing view, giving the illusion that each grouping is in a private bower.

In the daytime, this parlor is flooded with natural light from three crystal walls opening onto a magnificent garden. Even at night, the gardens outside are a delight to the eyes as hundreds of tiny lights sparkle and gleam in a myriad of colors, miniature stars caught in nets of flower-laden vines.

node.name: Armiger's Mansion, Foreign Exchange
node.description: In contrast to the serene atmosphere of the outer teller area, the foreign exchange fairly thrums with the energy of motion and magic. An iron-banded door set into the rear of the building bursts open at regular intervals, admitting dark-robed moon mages accompanied by sweating porters grunting under the weight of padlocked boxes. Apprentices unpack stacks of exotic coinage under the watchful eyes of senior clerks, filling racks that are quickly conveyed to frantically gesturing tellers.

node.name: Armiger's Mansion, Garden of Fountains
node.description: Tucked between the high outer wall and the sturdy shoulder of the manse, this tiny garden somehow seems much larger than it really is. A central fountain rises from mounds of deep green foliage covered with tiny star-shaped flowers of a silver-white hue. A narrow path of crushed alabaster disappears into a compact, tree-shrouded glen.

node.name: Armiger's Mansion, Garden Bower
node.description: Miniature lunat trees form a quiet bower removed from the garden nearby. The soft music of a fountain sweetens the grove as if butterflies had been given the gift of song. A mossy hummock rises like a bench in the center. The air is rich with the earthy smell of turf mingled with the soft scent of the many flowers growing all about.

node.name: Armiger's Mansion, Gemseller
node.description: Set off the floor of the Foreign Exchange, this small niche is home to gemsmith Thramis Marflet. Several brightly burning wax pillars illuminate the oak counter where the gemseller's tools of the trade sit. Dotting the gleaming countertop, piles of loose gemstones refract the candlelight onto the walls in a glimmering pastel light show.

node.name: Salt Yard, Top of the Mound
node.description: You stand atop a huge salt mound in the middle of the yard, struggling to keep your footing on the slippery surface. Around you on all sides, the city and the surrounding countryside stretches out in a colorful canvas. To the west and south, the river winds its slow course past the town and out into the farmlands and forests beyond. To the north, the narrow streets and low buildings of Riverhaven sit nestled within the tall city walls.

node.name: War Mage Tower, Earth Floor
node.description: Bare, dark soil forms the floor underfoot. The stony walls surrounding this circular room are similarly devoid of decoration, keeping instead the plain, natural look preferred by those mages who favor the element of Earth. Doors leading to the initiates' cells line the walls.

node.name: Warrior Mage Guild, Sanctuary
node.description: The walls of the small, dark cavern press close together, almost as if the earth were trying to reclaim this hole in its heart. A small crack far above is the only possible exit from this place. While wide enough to crawl out, it is doubtful anyone could squeeze their way back through.

node.name: Bantheld's Ironworks, Backroom
node.description: Several workers grunt and sweat in this storage area as they lift and move huge crates of armor and accessories. A gruff-looking Gor'Tog peers at you with a look which asks without words, Just what are you doing in my kingdom? Several of the wooden boxes are open revealing different types of rings and plates used in making armor.

node.name: Clerics' Guild, Guildmaster's Office
node.description: The guildmaster's office is plain and austere, lit only by a single brass lantern resting atop a small neat desk. A narrow cot, table, and a narrow footlocker beneath the bed complete the furnishings. The walls and floor are simple stone, with a small prayer rug resting against one wall before a glittering silver icon.

node.name: Clerics' Guild, Hallway
node.description: The hallway runs along the center of the building, flanked by simple wooden doors leading to the cells where the guild's acolytes live. Most of the doors are closed, but one stands open with a smiling robed monk waiting just inside.

node.name: Clerics' Guild, Meditation Room
node.description: This tiny cell is utterly devoid of all ornament. A bright fire burns in a simple stone pit in the center of the room, strangely smokeless. The flickering light casts surreal shadows on the smooth white walls. A smiling monk in a simple brown robe glances quietly at you from his position near the door.

node.name: Town Jail, The Cell
node.description: A very small barred window provides some fresh air to this barren room.
