The walls, made of iron reinforced oak, would be barren were it not for the shackle rings placed every few feet apart. A stone floor provides the only place to sit or lay. A small wooden bucket sits in the corner but as you begin to approach it, the smell convinces you quickly that you don't want to know what's still in there.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Hallway
node.description: A single torch lights the short length of the hallway, its fitful flame casting more shadow than light. Only a few strides in length, the cool stone floor terminates its journey at the base of a steep stair.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Cell
node.description: A few feet across and a scant Gor'Tog height in depth, this tiny cell is completely bare of any adornment save a sputtering oil torch. The grey roughly finished stone of the walls is oddly uneven in size and shape and the flickering light gives a rippling impression as if seen underwater.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Hallway
node.description: Delicately embroidered tapestries hang along the walls, accentuating the cool blue of the marble floor. A thick carpet runner, woven with bold geometric shapes, leads the eye down the corridor to where it jogs westward.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Conservatory
node.description: Gleaming with a lemon oil and elbow grease polish, massive oak bookshelves overflow with haphazard stacks of manuscripts, scrolls, bound manuals and half-built instruments. A leather chair, large enough to hold two Elotheans side-by-side, sits facing a set of etched glass doors. Brass candle stands fitted with lit beeswax pillars cast warm pools of illumination and the middle of the room is occupied by a battered podium, its surface covered with curling sheets of parchment.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Terrace
node.description: A riotous landscape of life sprawls over the entire rooftop of the guild, sending the pungent odor of rich soil and growing things rising into the air. From tiny bowls holding seedlings to behemoth tubs hosting fruit trees, containers are scattered across every inch of the flagstones. A slim trail wends its way around an apricot tree, a swing dangling from its branches, before twisting out of sight behind a flowering calodendrum.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Silver Room
node.description: A tall flambeau, filled with dozens of lit candle pillars, casts a glimmering curtain of light across a delicate curio cabinet snuggled into a corner of the charcoal-grey walls. A cream rug with the guild insignia embroidered in silver thread cushions a tall three-legged stool and ornately carved music stand.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Green Room
node.description: Myriad shades of green give this room the aura of a forest glen. From the deep emerald of the wall hangings, like summer leaves on an oak, to the pale spring grass berylline of the carpet, the glade-like illusion is spoiled only by the music stand and tall stool in the center of the floor.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Blue Room
node.description: Linen-crisp clouds float across a deep indigo horizon. Upon a second look, it becomes apparent that the summer sky is actually painted upon the ceiling. The richly colored fresco is accentuated by the pale blue of a cushioned chair and the eggshell shade of the walls.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Plum Room
node.description: A loveseat, upholstered in a velvet dyed a dark plum, draws the eye to the center of the floor where a tall mahogany music stand waits patiently to hold the latest ballad or satire. Thickly woven hangings and rugs, dyed in shades of gold and plum, give a warm and elegant aura to the room.

node.name: House of Bardic Blues, Shadowed Niche
node.description: Carefully placed sconces hold candles which cheerfully attempt to light this small area. The walls are draped in light blue silk woven with silvery threads which help reflect the candlelight. A display stand holds several baskets that show off artistically arranged jewelry pieces.

node.name: Traders' Guild, Trading Pit
node.description: The Pit is a crowded and noisy place full of rushing messengers and shouting Traders. Deals are being made and unmade all about you as rows of numbers are scrawled and erased on chalkboards almost faster than you can read them. Here and there, Traders shout out offers or counter-offers to one another as their scribes make hasty notes on wax tablets. Goods and materials for half the province pass through the many hands at work all about you.

node.name: City Statements
node.description: Plush lambswool carpeting in the foyer gives way to a polished oak plank floor supporting an array of building materials. Although the best of the inventory has been used to furnish the shop's exterior, the selection on offer within is still attractive to the eye, and clearly of good quality. The attendant, Junalar, is a meticulously-dressed man who seems to spend a good deal of his time polishing fingerprints off the merchandise.

node.name: City Statements, Doors of Distinction
node.description: The polished oak plank floor serves as a suitable display area for a selection of unpretentious doors which stand in tidy rows around the room. A willowy Elothean saleswoman leans casually against the central counter, wincing occasionally as the sound of hammers pounds from a back room and rattles the shutters on the oak-framed window overlooking the street.

node.name: Riverhaven, Carousel Square
node.description: A massive conical building rises from the square's center, its snowy alabaster surfaces gleaming brilliantly against the drab backdrop of the surrounding stone and wood. A bejeweled mosaic set above an oval doorway reads "THE CAROUSEL."

A massive conical building rises from the square's center, its snowy alabaster surfaces gleaming brilliantly against the drab backdrop of the surrounding stone and wood. Rows of torches encircle the structure's girth, their flames wavering lightly with the surrounding commotion and casting the building in sconces of shifting red tint. A bejeweled mosaic set above an oval doorway reads THE CAROUSEL.

node.name: Riverhaven, Carousel
node.description: Paneled in a rich dark wood of exotic origin, the walls of this circular room support a vast framework of iron and timbers rising to the building's apex. Countless gears, pulleys and weights within the structure form the strikingly complex and beautiful mechanism which drives the Carousel.

node.name: Riverhaven, Carousel Desk
node.description: A long wooden desk spans the width of the western wall. Brass lanterns hang from the ceiling, and the floor behind the desk is covered in spotless red tile.

node.name: Riverhaven, Carousel Booth
node.description: A polished wooden lever protrudes from the eastern wall of the small, ebony-panelled room, flanking a slightly rusted iron door to the north.

node.name: Noble Inn Stable, Tack Room
node.description: Even the small tack room shows the marks of fine craftsmanship and attention to detail. The brick floor is laid out in a herringbone pattern, and the terrazzo walls are polished to a soft gleam.

node.name: Noble Inn, Stablemaster's Office
node.description: The stablemaster's office lacks the opulent amenities offered to his charges. The brick floor is laid out in a herringbone pattern, and the terrazzo walls are polished to a soft gleam, but the only furnishings are a wooden stool and a flame-scarred oak table. A loft overhead presumably leads to a storage area, but no ladder is in sight to let you get there.

node.name: Noble Inn, Ballroom
node.description: Lines of soft black carpeting along the walls give way to a smooth polished wooden dance floor in the center of the room. Atop a marble dais against the far wall stands what looks like a throne, veiled under a cloth of rich black velvet. Opposite the throne is a sunken area where musicians would play for the grand balls held here. Faded banners embroidered with coats of arms hang in a brightly colored parade from the high beamed ceiling overhead.

node.name: Aldamus Guesthouse, Dormitory
node.description: Windows at either end of the long room provide a cool breeze in the dormitory. A double row of cots, separated by wood-framed parchment screens, provides inexpensive sleeping quarters to guests newly arrived in the town of Riverhaven.

node.name: The Masinyo Audru, Fore Waist
node.description: Slightly shorter than the main mast, the fore mast rises up with its stays and other rigging shooting off of it in all of the proper directions. The fore shroud's lanyards are secured to polished chain-plates on the side of the ship, supporting the mast laterally. A black-painted bulwark surrounds the deck, slightly lower along the starboard side to allow for easier disembarking once the vessel is moored.

node.name: The Masinyo Audru, Fore Topmast
node.description: The foretop platform rests at the head of the fore mast. Aftward from here the main mast and its rigging is visible. The vessel's bow is below and forward with its jigged sails and the fore stay which is rigged to the bowsprit.

node.name: Seli's Armory, Workshop
node.description: The scent of freshly cured leather mixes with the sharp tang of burning wax rising from a large vat in the center of the room. Bits of cuirboiled leather dry on wooden molds hung from the ceiling overhead. Awls, hammers and decorative rivets lie scattered amid scraps of leather, silk laces and pots of various dyes and stains atop the dented wooden table. Stacks of cured and uncured hides stand in neat piles along the western wall.

node.name: Riverhaven, Small House
node.description: The surrounding buildings would obscure the small house tucked neatly between its more imposing neighbors if it were not for the single candle burning in the window facing the street. From the gate on the street, a brick path leads through the yard to the entrance.

Cast into perpetual shadow by the surrounding buildings, this small house is easily missed by the casual passerby. Thin, white lace curtains are drawn back in the window facing the street. Smooth white stones cover the small front yard, a row of bright red bricks cuts through the floor of white creating a path from the gate to the front door.

node.name: Small House, Main Room
node.description: The interior is bright and cheerful as the stained woodwork contrasts the brightness of the whitewashed walls. Covering more than half of the wooden floor, a deep crimson rug divides the room into a foyer and living area. A polished cloak rack stands along the south wall. On the opposite side of the room, an opulent set of chairs has been arranged around a small mahogany table.

node.name: Dilapidated House, Small Room
node.description: The small bedroom barely holds the vast amount of toys that are scattered around a thick oval carpet. Upon the bed a battle of wooden soldiers appears to have taken place with the Humans the victor over the annihilated mass of carved Elven figurines. Hanging above, from a wire that stretches from wall to wall, a stuffed silk balloon carries a miniature gondola through the air. Cubbyholes crafted into the north wall of the room store the wardrobe of the room's young owner.

node.name: Small House, Master Bedroom
node.description: A brass bed frame with an over-stuffed mattress dominates the center of the room. Sheer white lace bed curtains are tied back to the brass posts that nearly scrape the ceiling. Atop a mahogany chest that lies at the foot of the bed, a pile of thick wool blankets stands ready to provide that extra warmth needed to fend off the chill of a Riverhaven night.

node.name: Small House, Kitchen
node.description: Highly polished floorboards and the bright yellow walls amplify the moderate light that the kitchen gets, making this the brightest room in the house. A small table opposite the water basin has place settings for three. Hanging above either side of the water basin, two wicker baskets of flowers are in magnificent bloom despite the limited amount of sunlight.

node.name: Mayor's Mansion, Entrance Hall
node.description: Wide and spacious, the imposing room features a high vaulted ceiling stretching up to the second story. Gleaming white marble mined from the finest Therengian quarries tiles the floor, softened by a vivid Musparan silk rug. A long mistwood table lines each of the side walls, both supporting ostentatious arrangements of fresh-cut flowers.

node.name: Mayor's Mansion, Sitting Room
node.description: Stationed opposite each other, a pair of plush couches offers regulars and visitors ample opportunity to relax and converse. A collection of paintings depicting the Therengian countryside hang from the mistwood-paneled walls, a convenient topic of discussion whenever an exchange grows dull. The miniature bar off to one side appears fully stocked and supports several rows of crystal snifters atop its polished marble surface.

node.name: Mayor's Mansion, Dining Room
node.description: Stretching nearly the length of the entire area, an ornate mistwood table provides more than adequate space for hosting large parties or meals for a few. Several chairs of the same wood flank the table, and a glittering crystal chandelier overhead douses the room with ambient light. A multi-shelved cabinet rests in one corner, its glass door revealing the excessive amount of porcelain dinnerware and sterling silver flatware inside.

node.name: Mayor's Mansion, Kitchen
node.description: The brightly lit area is home to dozens of shiny pots and pans dangling from a ceiling rack. Covering the island in the middle of the room, various cooking utensils are made available for quick grabbing during rushed preparation. Numerous mistwood cabinets sprawl across the painted white walls, and the double-basined sink allots more space for stray dishes and containers.

node.name: Mayor's Mansion, Upstairs Hallway
node.description: A carved railing permits observers the chance to overlook the foyer below. Filling the space with light and scent, a detailed gaethzen rose sprinkled with fragrant oil hangs overhead. The glow highlights the characteristic green veins of the mistwood flooring, buffed meticulously for an immaculate presentation.

node.name: Mayor's Mansion, Guest Room
node.description: Draped with a sheer gossamer canopy, the modest mistwood bed fits comfortably in the corner near a tall glass window. A small couch lines the opposing wall, with a colorful Musparan silk area rug in the center of the room to break up the monotony. Adjacent to the door, a porcelain washbasin and a clean white cloth sit atop a stout utility stand.

node.name: Mayor's Mansion, Master Bedroom
node.description: Piled high with down pillows, the massive bed is dressed in the best silk coverings Muspar'i has to offer. A hefty chest at the foot and the broad desk in the corner completes the mistwood furniture theme. Designed with a corresponding bench seat, a large bay window overlooks the activity on the commons.

node.name: Mayor's Mansion, Dressing Room
node.description: Light reflects off practically every surface of the room due to the multiple mirrors stationed strategically about. A colossal mistwood wardrobe takes up the entire rear wall, filled to bursting with every piece of male attire imaginable. Several shoe trees form an accessory forest underneath the dimpled glass window.

node.name: Dunshade Manor, Front Lawn
node.description: Nothing seems to be alive in this shadow-filled yard. Large skeletal trees loom over the path, their dry brown leaves swirling and skittering in drifting patterns across the barren lawn. The walkway's paving stones are broken or missing in random spots, and occasionally a large flat stone protrudes upright, as if it had been heaved up out of the ground. A large two-story building squats at the end of the yard, the flared eaves of its tiled roof hanging over a wide front porch.

node.name: Sandcastle Cove, Driftwood Designs
node.description: Moderately-priced home accessories created from natural materials line the walls of this small shop. The owner, Rastmarrest, sits at the entrance, greeting customers with a friendly nod as he carves a small statuette from driftwood.

node.name: Riverhaven, A Cramped Corridor
node.description: This cramped space runs in a straight line for the length of a moderately sized building. The lighting provided by a pair of hanging lanterns is little better than complete darkness and the space is restrictive enough to make even the bravest of Gor'Togs feel a twinge of claustrophobia. Though the space has received enough care to remain reasonably clean, long scratches on the floor reveal a history of somewhat less than gentle treatment.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, Beneath a Chicken Coop
node.description: An occasional feather and the rank smell of the chicken coop drift through the air of the bolthole. Overhead, footsteps slap against the cobblestoned streets as the residents of the Halfling quarter make their way about their business. Gaps between the floorboards allow a bit of light to filter in from outside.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, Basement of Noot's Teahouse
node.description: Boxes and crates have been carefully piled to leave this part of the basement hidden from view. The low ceiling provides a definite hazard to the heads of taller races as they make their way over to a low door in the back corner.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, Near the Pawnshop
node.description: A group of men and women hunker down around a crate in one corner of this small shed, their attention focused on the cards in their hands. The shack seems at first glance to be a flimsy affair, but despite the splintered boards, no drafts chill the interior of the structure. Bales of straw piled around the door in the brick wall muffle the noise of the street outside and shield the glow of the lantern hanging from the ceiling. Rickety wooden stairs lead down into darkness.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, The Rookery
node.description: Built out of scraps from wooden crates and boxes, the bolthole is little more than a rough shelter from the wind. An arch at the back of the shelter leads into a brick building in somewhat better repair than most around the neighborhood. The smell of cooking onions and cabbages permeates the air, almost masking the sour stench of dirt and worse.

node.name: Riverhaven, A Wretched Hovel
node.description: The chill dirt floor is criss-crossed by slender lines of light as they pass through gaps in the wooden plank walls. The 'door' is little more than a heavy piece of cloth with a few loose boards leaning against it to keep it from being blown inward by the occasional stiff breeze. Deep shadows cloak the far corners of the hovel, undisturbed by light or wind in spite of nature's best efforts.

node.name: Noble Inn Stables, Brokerage Office
node.description: Traders congregate at the local stables, buying and selling horses and ponies. The office lacks the usual plush accouterments found in the Traders' guild. Instead of working behind polished mahogany desks, the clerks perch atop piles of sweet-smelling hay as they record the sales.

node.name: Noble Inn, Paladin Representative's Quarters
node.description: Blue-grey silk draperies hang from a central point in the room's high ceiling, fanning out to fall in soft folds that conceal the walls. A glass lantern hanging from the ceiling casts a warm glow over a sand table in the center of the room, and a folding screen curtains off one corner. The windows are opened wide to let the night air carry with it the scent of the forest beyond the town walls.

Blue-grey silk draperies hang from a central point in the room's high ceiling, fanning out to fall in soft folds that conceal the walls. A glass lantern hangs above a sand table in the center of the room, and a folding screen curtains off one corner. The windows are opened wide to provide a view of the town walls and the forest beyond.

node.name: Saltfisher Inn, Basement
node.description: Even under the inn, you can still smell the fish aroma wafting from the nearby warehouses, mixing in with the dry dusty air. A few wooden crates and some coiled ropes are the only occupants of the room. An open door to your east leads into Harwell's back office.

node.name: Saltfisher Inn, Harwell's Office
node.description: Harwell himself is upstairs, busy with his patrons, but when he finds a few moments of quiet, he comes here to count, among other things, his inventory and his money. An ironwood desk sits huddled inbetween mounds of crates and boxes that hold most of Harwell's dry stock. A lone lantern sits on the desk as if it were the guardian of all its light shines on. A quill pen and heaps of parchment paper sit stacked neatly atop the desk.

node.name: Riverhaven, Smugglers' Passage
node.description: Winding beneath the businesses of Riverhaven, this dank tunnel must be home to all manner of vermin, as evidenced by scattered droppings and shredded piles of rags. Walls shored up with brick are covered by a thick layer of moss and algae, a result of the constant seepage of briny water.

node.name: Riverhaven, Smugglers' Passage
node.description: Winding and twisting beneath the foundations of Riverhaven's finer establishments, the tunnel is neatly bricked and mortared, and a tall ladder has been carefully bolted into the wall. Water seeping from the surface above has begun to erode the stonework, as evidenced by the mineralized deposits that are collecting on the ceiling.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Hallway
node.description: The ardent sound of anvil work carries from doors on either side of the hallway and echoes off the well-fitted granite floor. A pair of masterwork weapons lines the wall as testament to the skilled work accomplished within.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Crafting Shop
node.description: A storefront backed up by boxes and cabinetry offers tools for sale. Attendants rush back and forth helping customers and shout above the din of forging hammers smacking metal. A stockpile of coal sits off to one side.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Supply Shop
node.description: Bins of recently mined metal await sale next to eager attendants happily serving crafters' needs. Several nearby crates contain additional materials for sale, including already smelted ingots.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Office
node.description: A massive iron table decorated with pewter miniatures dominates this small office. A soot-stained bookshelf and an oak chest with an ornate haralun lock sit nearby. A chart detailing the techniques available for training hangs from the wall.

A massive iron table decorated with pewter miniatures dominates this small office. A soot-stained bookshelf and an oak chest with an ornate haralun lock sit nearby. Three charts detailing the techniques for weaponsmithing, armorsmithing and blacksmithing hang from the wall.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Crucible
node.description: Soot-stained stone walls rise up to a peaked roof where smoke and ash escape through several air vents. To one side of the room a granite crucible hangs suspended over a glowing fire. A pile of fuel lay scattered across the room from it and black footprints cover the stony ground.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Forge
node.description: Even the walls have accumulated moisture from the incredible heat rising from the forge fires. A short distance away sits a hefty anvil with an extra long horn, a slack tub filled with water and a messy pile of fuel. The clang of metal on metal assaults your ears as nearby forgers ply the trade.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Crucible
node.description: Smaller than the other forging sections, this area shows extreme scorching from the great heat rising up from the forge fires. Not an inch of the walls or floor has escaped, and now sits completely blacked out. A granite crucible hangs from the ceiling over a glowing fire and a tidy fuel pile rests in the corner.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Forge
node.description: Squeezed in as though space were a premium, this forging area is the smallest yet. An iron anvil and slack tub occupy one corner and a pile of fuel occupies the other. A distinct lack of clutter is the only thing keeping this area useable for getting work done.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Crucible
node.description: A cozy little room for forging, this room dampens the outside pounding noises for some reason. In the room's center, a sturdy granite crucible hangs over a glowing fire and a pile of fuel occupies the corner.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Forge
node.description: A low ceiling and thicker walls seem to muffle outside noises here. An iron anvil with a thick horn sits across from a slack tub filled with water. A pile of fuel rests atop a leather tarp in the corner.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Crucible
node.description: A large granite crucible hanging over a glowing fire rests in the center of the room. The fire pit beneath the crucible forms a star pattern from the way in which its stones arrange.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Forge
node.description: Dents and chips line the walls as though someone once became careless with a forging hammer. Placed diagonal to the wall is an iron anvil and a slack tub filled with water.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Crucible
node.description: The freshly scrubbed walls of this smelting spot indicate it is the preferred place for upper class patrons. An organized pile of fuel sits nearby, and a large granite crucible hangs from decorated leather straps above a glowing fire.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Forge
node.description: Barely any soot remains on the walls or floor here, despite constant use. A nice leather tarp holds a mountain of fuel, and nearby is a large anvil and forge fire that crackles and pops in the low light.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, Beneath a Chicken Coop
node.description: Crates are piled one atop the other along each wall, some marked with the seal of the Trader's guild, others conspicuous in their lack of any markings whatsoever. Boards laid across the crates serve to shore up the ceiling, though bits of dirt still trickle down as wagons roll over the cobblestoned street above. A shielded lantern provides illumination for those who seek to practice their skills, secure from prying eyes.

node.name: Thieves' Guild, A Shadowed Corner
node.description: Dampness coats the walls and floors of the boltholes used by the Thieves' Guild, barely noticeable as a faint, musty odor overlain by the earthy fragrance of wine and spices. A thick rush mat covers the floor in this shadowed corner, though it's hard to see through the piles of boxes and crates, barrels and bundles, all heaped atop each other.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, A Narrow Tunnel
node.description: Water trickles through the dirt ceiling, falling with a loud *plop* against the floor. Someone has laid down rushes and wooden boards to reduce the chance of muddy footprints that could lead the guards to the guild's lair. The passage is narrow enough to require well-fed Gor'Togs to sidle through sideways if they want to avoid knocking against the beams that support the walls and ceiling.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, Muddy Cavern
node.description: The tunnel widens into a small cavern supported by an ingenious octagon arrangement of interlocking wooden beams along the walls and ceiling. Mud forms an irregular moat spanned by wooden boards anchored to a rocky island piled high with barrels at the center of the cavern. Fires burn around the perimeter of the space, helping to dry out the mud and keep the area warm.

node.name: Thieves' Guild, A Shadowed Corner
node.note: GL Thief Halfling|GL Thief Own Kind|GL Thief Kind|GL Thief 2
node.description: Dampness coats the walls and floors of the boltholes used by the Thieves' Guild, barely noticeable as a faint, musty odor overlain by the earthy fragrance of wine and spices. A thick rush mat covers the floor in this shadowed corner, though it's hard to see through the piles of boxes and crates, barrels and bundles, all heaped atop each other.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, Small Cavern
node.description: Musty straw squelches unpleasantly underfoot, absorbing the water that trickles down the walls of the cavern. Empty crates serve as tables to hold muslin-wrapped bolts of jewel-toned velvet, pale silk and white lace, rapidly tarnishing silver or small boxes filled with assorted jewelry. Other crates are piled one atop the other, their contents hidden from view, with narrow aisles running between them.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, Small Cavern
node.description: A workbench at the back of the cavern contains an array of jeweler's tools -- a small vice, a brazier, a hammer and some pliers, and other less readily recognizable pieces of equipment for removing precious gems and melting down metals into unidentifiable lumps. The lamp above the bench is unlit, and the jeweler nowhere in sight. Wooden crates stacked one atop the other line the center of the cavern, forming small passages through the cave.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, Small Cavern
node.description: The floor slopes down to the west and south from this, the highest (and dryest) point in the cavern. Smoked hams and sausages, bags of salt and spices, all hang from hooks in the ceiling. Other perishable goods such as fabric are stacked in open crates which line the walls.

node.name: Thieves' Guild, A Shadowed Corner
node.note: GL Thief Pawnshop|GL Thief Selling Goods|GL Thief 3
node.description: Dampness coats the walls and floors of the boltholes used by the Thieves' Guild, barely noticeable as a faint, musty odor overlain by the earthy fragrance of wine and spices. A thick rush mat covers the floor in this shadowed corner, though it's hard to see through the piles of boxes and crates, barrels and bundles, all heaped atop each other.

node.name: Riverhaven, Storage Area
node.description: Shipping crates are stacked throughout the area in a manner that indicates either a very complex method of organization or total chaos. Each crate is stamped with the names of several locations that were probably intended to indicate their origin, destination, and various outposts through which they passed. Curiously, however, not a single crate is marked in such a way that indicates that it ought to have ended up here.

node.name: Thieves' Guild, A Shadowed Corner
node.note: GL Thief Silvermoon Road|GL Thief Silvermoonroad|GL Thief 4
node.description: Dampness coats the walls and floors of the boltholes used by the Thieves' Guild, barely noticeable as a faint, musty odor overlain by the earthy fragrance of wine and spices. A thick rush mat covers the floor in this shadowed corner, though it's hard to see through the piles of boxes and crates, barrels and bundles, all heaped atop each other.

node.name: Riverhaven, A Narrow Passage
node.description: This cramped space is reasonably well enclosed, although the rough planks do little to hold back the dampness which seems to ooze out of the walls. One end of this corridor ends at a small opening, giving access to the hovel outside. The opposite corner is too deeply cloaked in shadows to judge what it contains.

node.name: Thieves' Guild, A Shadowed Corner
node.note: GL Thief Crescent Way|GL Thief Crescentway|GL Thief 5
node.description: Dampness coats the walls and floors of the boltholes used by the Thieves' Guild, barely noticeable as a faint, musty odor overlain by the earthy fragrance of wine and spices. A thick rush mat covers the floor in this shadowed corner, though it's hard to see through the piles of boxes and crates, barrels and bundles, all heaped atop each other.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, A Cramped Apartment
node.description: No more than five paces from end to end, this tiny room on the first floor of the building is full of worn-out furniture. Tufts of padding poke out of comfortable chairs, a sofa has a small chest propping up a missing leg, and the low table in the center of the room is marred by water rings. A clear path has been left between the arch on the outer wall and the cellar stairs. Curiously enough, there doesn't seem to be any entrance from this apartment into the main part of the tenement.

node.name: Thieves' Guild Bolthole, Cellar
node.description: A lantern hangs by the base of the stairs, casting a soft circle of light about ten paces across, but since the cellar is closer to twenty paces in width, much of the area is in shadows. More lanterns would pose a risk of fire or the chance of outside notice, always something to be avoided by those who do business here. The single lamp provides just enough light to see the piles of boxes, crates and barrels that fill the dank, dirt-floored basement.

node.name: Thieves' Guild, A Shadowed Corner
node.description: Dampness coats the walls and floors of the boltholes used by the Thieves' Guild, barely noticeable as a faint, musty odor overlain by the earthy fragrance of wine and spices. A thick rush mat covers the floor in this shadowed corner, though it's hard to see through the piles of boxes and crates, barrels and bundles, all heaped atop each other.

node.name: Riverhaven, Carousel Chamber
node.description: A sturdy vault, set in the back wall, stands ready for your use. The floor is covered by a soft thick carpet, and the rooms walls are polished gold pine. Looking at the back wall, you notice a tiny gap between it and the rest of the room. A multifaceted quartz crystal hangs suspended from the ceiling.

node.name: Knight's Hall, Foyer
node.description: Column-ringed, this circular room has a high ceiling painted in birds, clouds and deep blue sky. A soft light is provided by oil lamps in bowls that are suspended in rings. Ornate, gilded chairs stand before a grey marble fireplace with a crackling fire. Across from the seating area, a large listings board hangs between two of the three arches providing access to the shop fronts.

node.name: Knight's Hall, Keep Room
node.description: Placed centrally, a large and heavily varnished square mistwood case with a glass dome is the only piece of furniture in the room. Portraits in ornate frames line the two long walls with the Therengia standard on brass poles standing guard at each end of the room. Shoppers and merchants stop to gaze at the panorama before moving on to their business.

node.name: Knight's Hall, Dungeon Room
node.description: Manacles and leg irons hang from the dark granite-colored walls. Low-set limestone tables with recesses carved into them are covered with heavy glass plates. A brazier stands ready in the middle of the room with dark, cold coals and a large bellow leaning against it. Oiled torches in heavy pewter sconces provide a flickering light and a haze of smoke near the ceiling.

node.name: Knight's Hall, Storage Area
node.description: Large cabinets line all four walls, with plaques on each door pertaining to the various shops in the Hall. Heavy padlocks on steel chains keep them secure. A low cart on wheels stands vacant and ready to help transport the contents as each trader might need them. The thick oaken planks of the floor have been swept clear of all debris, but is marked in places where there might have been spills or falling objects.

node.name: Knight's Hall, Rose Room
node.description: Large crystal vases on cherrywood stands line the walls with two long rows of padded benches placed back to back down the center. Freshly cut roses of white, pink and deep red are carefully arranged in each vase, lending a heady scent to the room. Alert guards prevent curious children and lovesick young men escorting pretty young ladies from helping themselves to the flowers.

node.name: Knight's Hall, Warrior Room
node.description: Central in the room, a life-sized carved wooden warhorse stands rearing on a woven burgundy runner outlined in brass stanchions with velvet covered ropes. The steed is fully bedecked in a suit of polished plate, tassels of gold threads hanging from its harness and a brass-riveted scabbard hanging beside the black leather saddle. Paintings of stallions in battle are hung above high-backed gilded chairs placed near the entrances to the various shops.

node.name: Knight's Hall, Food Plaza
node.description: Leather-backed chairs and small tables in sets of two to four are arranged neatly inside a small wrought-iron partitioned area. Serving carts laded with food and drinks line the walls with staff ready to quickly wipe away all evidence of past partakers as customers and merchants stop for a small repast.

node.name: Knight's Hall, Children's Room
node.description: The oak walls have been whitewashed and then painted with a fanciful woodland scene in bright colors. A young girl and boy watch from behind a large pine tree as animals gather peacefully around a sparkling stream as wisps dance in the air around them. An equal number of small stools in white and silver are placed on a large checkerboard painted onto the floor.

node.name: Knight's Hall, Theatre Room
node.description: Chairs in short rows are seated before a dais with a miniature stage set in a large box with a red velvet curtain hanging on the back. The bright colorful hat of a jester puppet peeks through, awaiting the return of its handler. Playbills from past performances of the Theren Theatre group are hung in simple frames. A large barrel filled with bags of popcorn is filled by an industrious staff member.

node.name: Knight's Hall, World Room
node.description: Tapestries embroidered with battle scenes with noble paladins, valiant archers and mages releasing lightning bolts and balls of fire against their enemies are displayed on all four walls. The floor is painted with an elaborate map of the five provinces of Elanthia that has been protected by many coats of clear varnish. Children stop to follow the trade routes that have been outlined in grey, wandering on tip-toe through mountain ranges and rushing rivers alike.

node.name: Knight's Hall, The Back Room
node.description: Compact and dark-paneled, the room is full of discarded furniture pushed together into all four corners. Mismatched paintings hang askew on the walls a seascape, a faded portrait of a dark-haired woman and large oil of splashes of color that someone has sliced from corner to corner. People move quickly into the shops and out, not caring to spend time loitering in this dimly-lit area.

node.name: Knight's Hall, Administration Office
node.description: Long benches line both sides of the door, filling quickly as another merchant or vendor is called up to the counter. Clerks with long-suffering looks speak to the traders in low tones, as each appears to haggle over prices on sheets they hold or file a complaint about thieves, loiterers or noisy children.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Book Store
node.description: Well-fitted granite brick encloses this space. Thick oak doors exit onto the street, and a thick tarp leads deeper into the forging chambers. To the side a burly guard limits entry through a narrow arch. A rhythmic pounding echoes from inside the building.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Deed Vendor
node.description: Thick steel bars block access to a depot storing a multitude of resources and crafted goods. Workers hoist larger pieces atop massive shelving using an intricate network of ropes and pulleys.

node.name: Riverhaven Forging Society, Maker's Mark Shop
node.description: A selection of organized patterns, templates and designs for maker's marks line the walls. A handful of prestigious crafters browse the possibilities and discuss selections with nearby attendants. An arch leads back into the main lobby.

node.name: The Kree'la, Main Deck
node.description: The deck is split down the middle by an open pit, bracketed on each end by the two masts. The opening is more for ventilation for the rowers than for onlookers to look down on them, and rungs on each mast give access to the rower's pit. Aft, a set of stairs climb up to the pilot's deck and underneath are located the only two cabins aboard the galley. Rigging rises up to the masts, holding them in place, and a rope ladder ascends the forward mast.

node.name: Fang Cove, Fate's Fortune Lane
node.description: A towering marble archway opens a gap in the wall to the north and separates the ongoing construction and somewhat more refined completed structures of Fate's Fortune Lane from the crude structures and makeshift walkway along the beach. The entrance to a squat, wide bungalow sits in opposition to the arch, and the sheltering cliffs of Fang's Peak rise up from behind it. To either side of the arch, cobblestones of different shapes and sizes have been laid out to form the wide Fate's Fortune Lane.

node.name: Noble Inn, White Room
node.description: Painted vines twine against a lattice background along the walls, creating a charming garden bower around the white wicker bed. A plush moss-green rug, soft and inviting, covers the pale birch floor. Dried lavender blossoms fill the room with a sweet herbal fragrance from a bowl of potpourri on the bedside table.

node.name: Noble Inn, Blue Room
node.description: Flames crackle in a black cast iron stove atop a tiled hearth, filling the room with an inviting warmth and the scent of pine. Plump white linen pillows create a soft nest atop the deep blue silk coverlet on the bed. Nearby, a round cream table has been painted with pale blue forget-me-nots, echoing the painted border on the walls.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Book Store
node.description: Shelves of books line the walls of this otherwise simple room. Set off to one side is a long oak counter with a long silk tablecloth dangling just slightly over the edges where patrons wait patiently to purchase their work books.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Hallway
node.description: Clear glass cases span the length of the hallway, displaying fanciful quilts of all different shapes, colors and patterns. Upon a table set across from the displays is a simple bouquet of silk flowers within an ornate glass vase.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Supply Depot
node.description: Grand marble tables and shelves fill the room with fashionable product for sale. Upon the surfaces is a wide variety of stylish fabrics in a broad spectrum of color.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Tool Store
node.description: Devoid of decoration, rows of shelving line the walls and hold various tools for sale in the shop. Filling them are fine spools of thread, flat irons, straight pins and needles -- the absolute essentials for creating the perfect garment. Tiny cobwebs hang in the corners of the ceiling, strands dangling down to the surfaces below.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Hallway
node.description: Painted upon the center of a brown wall are women and men dressed in a variety of stylish clothing. From either side of the grandiose painting hang dark green curtains made of thick cloth which frame the work of art. A soft chaise lounge rests on the other side of the hall next to a series of workroom doors.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Hallway
node.description: Painted upon brown walls are soft green leaves that appear to be floating down from the branches of an unseen tree. Near the base, chipmunks and squirrels play with each other. Soft cloth mats rest before several workroom doors.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Office
node.description: Sheer green material dangles from the ceiling and flows down to the floor in billowing cascades surrounding a neat desk and chair. Hanging on the walls are framed sketches of various clothing designs, each drawn with an obviously skilled hand. Situated to one side of the room is a green velvet sofa before a masterfully carved oak table.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Weaving Room
node.description: Set in the back of the large workroom is a hefty loom. Hooks and shelves line the soft blue walls, holding various tools and spools of thread that are currently not in use. To the rear of the room is a large work table and bench.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Weaving Room
node.description: Set in the back of the large workroom is a hefty loom. Hooks and shelves line the deep purple walls, holding various tools and spools of thread that are currently not in use. To the rear of the room is a large work table and bench.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Weaving Room
node.description: Set in the back of the large workroom is a hefty loom. Hooks and shelves line the checkerboard walls, holding various tools and spools of thread that are currently not in use. To the rear of the room is a large work table and bench.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Spinning Room
node.description: Pale pink silk flowers carefully affixed to the soft blue walls create a gentle elegance to the room. Beneath a large spinning wheel is a white hide rug trimmed with thick ribbon. A large workbench and chair pressed against the back wall provide a convenient place to relax.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Spinning Room
node.description: Pale yellow silk flowers carefully affixed to the burnt orange walls create a gentle elegance to the room. Beneath a large spinning wheel is a yellow woven rug trimmed with black velvet tassels. A large workbench and chair pressed against the back wall provide a convenient place to relax.

node.name: Riverhaven Outfitting Society, Spinning Room
node.description: Brilliant orange silk flowers carefully affixed to the dark green walls create a gentle elegance to the room. Beneath a large spinning wheel is a padded silk rug trimmed with braided cord. A large workbench and chair pressed against the back wall provide a convenient place to relax.

node.name: Riverhaven Engineering Society, Main Hall
node.description: The bustling main hallway of the large building provides a place for people to gather and discuss new ideas with one another. Stone benches topped with soft cushions offer moderately comfortable seating for those who wish to rest their weary bones. On either side of the benches stand intricate pedestals which bear carved marble vases filled with floral bouquets.

node.name: Riverhaven Engineering Society, Paarupensteen's Office
node.description: An elaborate gold birdcage rests on a large stand, placed next to a makeshift desk in the center of the room. Along the far wall, a workbench bearing a variety of gadgets and tools display what Paarupensteen treasures most in life. Upon the wall above the workbench hangs a picture of a plump Halfling woman next to an equally so Halfling man.

node.name: Riverhaven Engineering Society, Repair Shop
node.description: Bustling back and forth from the shop's backroom, harried workers carry goods that are either in need of repair or have been completed. Behind a long counter, which spans nearly the width of the room, stands the shop's repairwoman. Upon the wall behind her are rows of shelves which hold repaired goods waiting for their owner to retrieve them.

node.name: Riverhaven Engineering Society, Hallway and Bookstore
node.description: Marbled flooring surrounded by white walls, which are accented with brass lanterns, span the length of the hall. Not as many crafters walk through this end of the building, though echoes of pounding hammers permeate the hallway. A carved sign bearing workshop rules hangs from the wall before three doors.

node.name: Riverhaven Engineering Society, Crafting Supplies
node.description: Like most of the Society Hall, the shop is neat and clean. Attendants bustle around with brooms and rags cleaning the marbled floors and smooth stone walls. Behind the counter are crates of supplies to restock the tables and countertops so that any crafter in need of a specific tool does not go without. Sheer black curtains upon a small oval window shield the shop from prying eyes outside.

node.name: Riverhaven Engineering Society, Resource Depot
node.description: Solid white stone walls encompass the marbled flooring of the shop. A large double door guarded by two Gor'Togs allows workers to travel between the store and the outside of the building where they bring in new shipments or prepare to be transferred to one of the workshops. Several raised platforms upon the floor bear heavy blocks of stone which are waiting to be crafted into furniture or unique decorations for the home.

Solid white stone walls encompass the marbled flooring of the shop. A large double door guarded by two Gor'Togs allows workers to travel between the store and the outside of the building where they bring in new shipments or prepare to be transferred to one of the workshops. Several raised platforms upon the floor bear thick logs and heavy blocks of stone which are waiting to be crafted into furniture or unique decorations for the home.

node.name: Riverhaven Engineering Society, Workshop
node.description: Smooth and clean white walls and floors bare of decorations span the room. Several workstations are set up within, each neat and tidy and set up to accommodate any particular needs a crafter could have. Standing next to the door is a pair of attendants who quietly wait for an opportunity to clear out the waste bucket or wipe down a dirty work area.

node.name: Riverhaven Engineering Society, Workshop
node.description: Set firmly against the smooth stone walls are various tables bearing stone carved items in various stages. Towards the far back of the room, roped off with a thick chain, is a large doorway to the outside, which is used to haul larger pieces outside the building for delivery. Attendants stand at the ready waiting to clean off tables once they have been cleared and empty waste buckets.

node.name: Riverhaven Engineering Society, Workshop
node.description: Not as neat and clean as the other workshops, this room is geared towards the crafting of smaller goods. Rows of tables line the room, holding various carved weapons and small decorations. Near the door, an inattentive attendant sits in a chair, her eyes closed and feet resting on an unused block of stone.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Entrance and Tool Store
node.description: Shelves showcasing a variety of alchemical tools line the thick stone walls of this room that is otherwise void of additional furniture. The ground shifts from dirt to rough-hewn stone outside a heavily reinforced passage leading downward into the laboratories themselves. A bright-eyed Moon Mage stands at the entrance to the earthen tunnel, welcoming society prospects and veterans alike.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Tunnel
node.description: A series of sconces dot the heavily reinforced walls of the tunnel leading deep into the heart of the Alchemy Society's laboratories, ensuring that any disastrous explosions are safely contained away from the populace above. Burly Human workers pass by intermittently, carefully guiding warning-labeled carts deep into the heart of the society.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Lobby and Supplies
node.description: Gaethzen spheres dot the ceiling of this the massive underground chamber, fully illuminating the heavy steel cases containing supplies located in the center of the room and brightening the long tunnels spreading outward to partitioned laboratories. A group of young Warrior Mages stand beside a scowling Gnomish Barbarian, ready to respond to any disasters taking place.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Workroom
node.description: A set of alchemical equipment is centered in this laboratory carved out of dense granite. The high ceilings are dotted with small holes that provide a way for any deadly gasses released to eventually make their way to the surface, while a passage to the southeast affords anyone in the room the chance to escape from a dangerous conflagration of chemicals.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Workroom
node.description: A set of alchemical equipment is centered in this laboratory carved out of dense granite. The high ceilings are dotted with small holes that provide a way for any deadly gasses released to eventually make their way to the surface, while a passage to the east affords anyone in the room the chance to escape from a dangerous conflagration of chemicals.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Workroom
node.description: A set of alchemical equipment is centered in this laboratory carved out of dense granite. The high ceilings are dotted with small holes that provide a way for any deadly gasses released to eventually make their way to the surface, while a passage to the northeast affords anyone in the room the chance to escape from a dangerous conflagration of chemicals.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Workroom
node.description: A set of alchemical equipment is centered in this laboratory carved out of dense granite. The high ceilings are dotted with small holes that provide a way for any deadly gasses released to eventually make their way to the surface, while a passage to the north affords anyone in the room the chance to escape from a dangerous conflagration of chemicals.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Workroom
node.description: A set of alchemical equipment is centered in this laboratory carved out of dense granite. The high ceilings are dotted with small holes that provide a way for any deadly gasses released to eventually make their way to the surface, while a passage to the northwest affords anyone in the room the chance to escape from a dangerous conflagration of chemicals.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Workroom
node.description: A set of alchemical equipment is centered in this laboratory carved out of dense granite. The high ceilings are dotted with small holes that provide a way for any deadly gasses released to eventually make their way to the surface, while a passage to the west affords anyone in the room the chance to escape from a dangerous conflagration of chemicals.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Workroom
node.description: A set of alchemical equipment is centered in this laboratory carved out of dense granite. The high ceilings are dotted with small holes that provide a way for any deadly gasses released to eventually make their way to the surface, while a passage to the southwest affords anyone in the room the chance to escape from a dangerous conflagration of chemicals.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Office
node.description: Musty boxes oozing long-abandoned alchemical experiments spill off of rust-eaten steel tables shoved into every corner of the constricting granite room. Chalk formulas are scratched haphazardly onto the soot-stained walls, with sparse moments of cleanliness only afforded to sections wiped clean for future notations.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Workroom
node.description: A set of alchemical equipment is centered in this laboratory carved out of dense granite. The high ceilings are dotted with small holes that provide a way for any deadly gasses released to eventually make their way to the surface, while a passage to the south affords anyone in the room the chance to escape from a dangerous conflagration of chemicals.

node.name: Riverhaven Alchemy Society, Book Store
node.description: A small shelf advertising available alchemical books sits below a chart on alchemical techniques on one side of the small enclosure, while the other side an exhausted clerk notes work order completions on a board.

node.name: Northern Pride, Main Deck
node.description: This is the only barge of its type to ply the waters of Lake Gwenalion. Ambitiously designed with an upper deck for passengers, its aft is completely given over to cargo. Built recently, everything about it smacks of economy and minimalism.

node.name: Old Boardwalk
node.description: Quite narrow and somewhat steep, the walkway's weathered wooden planks are incredibly old, though strong rivets leave them still quite sturdy. Unlit wrought iron lanterns hang from poles along the railings, splotches of rust peppering their dark metal. Turgid, salty air comes through the area on sporadic breezes, bringing all the scents of the river with it.

node.name: Boardwalk, Pigeon's Roost
node.description: Scores of squab and elder pigeons have taken up residence in the covered seating on either side of the boardwalk. Their coos intertwine with the burbling riverfront to almost musical effect. A fair number of the birds peck and poke their way across the planks without care for the stepping feet of passersby, decidedly interested in whatever tidbits they might drop.

node.name: Boardwalk, Steep Ramp
node.description: The boardwalk takes a sharp turn as it follows the river's length, coming closer to the river's waterline. Several rough-looking dock workers lean against the warped railings, speaking with each other in hushed tones. A derelict building is visible at the end of the boardwalk to the east, looking even older than the boardwalk.

node.name: Boardwalk, River View
node.description: Though the boardwalk offers a sweeping view of the river's blue-green water as it meets the muddy riverbanks, this portion of the boardwalk seems comparatively unpopular. Variegated greens, oranges and yellows dapple the craggy rocks that comprise the shore, the flowering mosses and brightly colored lichens bringing soft beauty to an otherwise dour landscape. Several tiny, dead fish are strewn about the wooden walkway, their bloated corpses untouched by the throngs of birds living in the surrounds.

node.name: Boardwalk, Tavern Approach
node.description: The boardwalk widens to meet the dimensions of the disheveled-looking tavern that lies at its end. Crafted entirely from salvaged materials, the building is a jumble of mismatched and ill-fitted castoffs, starkly contrasting the neat, brightly painted sign proclaiming it to be open for business. A large, crudely-cast bronze statue of an aquatic monster sits near the entrance, its surface a verdigris patina that lends a bit too much realism to the creature.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Lobby
node.description: Though smelling strongly of salt-stained wood and rotting fish, the lobby somehow manages to remain inviting in a decidedly well-worn fashion. Aged wood from shipping crates has been repurposed and fitted with sailcloth-covered cushions to create the benches lining the walls.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Narrow Hallway
node.description: Barely wide enough for a single full grown Gor'Tog to squeeze through sideways, the hallway is dimly lit with greasy lanterns hanging from the ceiling. Rusty stains streak the walls, visible through the salt-crusted fishing nets tacked over them. A soggy green carpet lies on the floor, hastily thrown over its plain wooden boards and only half-hiding an old stain.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Dining Room
node.description: Several paintings of fishing boats hang on the unfinished wooden panels that partially enclose this cramped dining room. A long counter serves to separate the eating area from the exposed kitchen, but does little to hide the view of the grimy cooking conditions. Mismatched chairs surround makeshift tables, most of them badly stained with greasy food and cheap wine.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Bar Room
node.description: Partially separated from the cramped dining area to the west by a series of unfinished wooden panels, the bar room feels quite open due to its sparse furnishings. Steel-legged stools line the heavily-stained bar, bolted firmly to the floor to prevent damage during drunken brawls. A bulky stack of liquor crates and beer kegs serves to further delineate the space.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Shadowy Corner
node.description: Nearly blocked off from all sides, this quiet little corner appears to be utilized mostly as a storage area. The briny smell that permeates the entire establishment is particularly strong here, no doubt due to the open barrels of fish shoved between the other boxes. A faint skittering can be heard from time to time as the vermin that gorge themselves on the poorly stored goods scurry to and fro in the darkness.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Gambler's Den
node.description: Several dartboards dot this room's mottled blue walls. Subdued desperation oozes from the players at the various card tables, punctuated by occasional cries of anger or greedy joy as the tides of fortune turn. In one corner, a group of craggy-looking riverfolk have huddled together tightly, attending to a game of dice on an overturned crate.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Narrow Hallway
node.description: Muddy bootprints mar the bare wooden floor in this portion of the windowless hallway, and the thick scent of tobacco wafts in from the smoking room to the north. A large, soiled tapestry hangs from the ceiling to cover the southern wall, the speckled mold peeking out from its edges hinting at the most likely reason for its placement.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Upstairs Hallway
node.description: More of a half-attic than a hallway, dim light streams in from cracks in the ceiling. Sailcloth tarps spread over the holes do their best to keep out inclement weather, though bad water stains attest to the tavern's overall neglect. A few planks have been haphazardly laid over a hole in the floor, a short-term solution that has become permanent.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Upstairs Hallway
node.description: Stacks of small boxes are piled up in the corners, nearly filling the end off the short hallway. A small porthole window looks out on the river, but view into the city is blocked by the side of a salt-stained warehouse. Spiders spin their webs in the bare rafters, feasting on the flies that buzz up from the dining room below.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Dimly Lit Room
node.description: The roof of this small room slopes down to the northern wall, and is relatively well-shingled in comparison to the hallway outside. Small motes of dust drift through the air, lit up by greasy oil lanterns hanging on the walls. The room's only real furnishing is a fairly good-sized bed stuffed with hay and a small chamberpot in the corner.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Dimly Lit Room
node.description: The roof of this small room slopes down to the northern wall, and is relatively well-shingled in comparison to the hallway outside. A small painting hangs on the eastern wall, depicting an enormous sea creature strangling a wooden ship. The room's only real furnishing is a fairly good-sized bed stuffed with hay and a small chamberpot in the corner.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Smoking Den
node.description: Set off from the adjacent gambling parlor by shabby tobacco-stained screens and algae-green paint, this lounge is furnished entirely with salvaged materials. A splotchy yellowed sofa flanked by fish barrels dominates one wall, while along another, several low stools surround a footlocker coffee table.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Private Booth
node.description: A blue-grey wooden table sits in the middle of this booth, contrasted by its nearly black benches. Situated high on the wall, a series of rusty sconces holds tallow candles that have been burned to near nubs, their dim light effecting a more ominous than cozy atmosphere. The heavy scent of smoke wafts in from beyond the dingy blue curtain.

node.name: The Tepid Faldesu, Private Booth
node.description: A naturally algae-green table sits in the middle of this booth, matching its benches. Dangling dangerously low, a rusted anchor chain suspends a fish-shaped lantern, its flickering light casting curious, shifting shadows across furnishings and occupants alike. The slight smell of mold lingers in the air, mixed with the smoke coming from beyond a greenish curtain.

node.name: Underground Passage
node.description: A constant 'drip, drip, drip' noise echoes through the air in the narrow passage, and the air smells heavily of damp moss. Naturally occurring ruby growths protrude from the walls surrounding the door, their sharpness dulled somewhat by polishing. Caught by the torchlight, the rubies cast a sanguine glow upon wood, stone, and occupants alike.

node.name: Underground Passage
node.description: The underground passage is narrow and the air feels bloated with water, almost suffocatingly clingy and thick. Carved niches hold torches that crackle and threaten to falter entirely in the dampness. Ruddy discoloration speckles the ground, a dark echo of the glinting mineral veins that wend through the pallid stone walls.

node.name: Underground Passage
node.description: The walls in this part of the passage are very smooth, as if some powerful force scoured them clean. Several small area rugs are thrown onto the floor to cover it, some of them soggy but most of them dry. A single gaethzen orb provides a harsh white light, making the relative darkness of the passages to the east and west seem like an endless blackness.

node.name: Underground Passage, Dead End
node.description: Roughly hewn from the surrounding stone, this chamber remains largely unadorned save for a trine of incarnadine gems set into the curving walls at even intervals. Brownish-red stains streak the floor, punctuated by larger, similarly colored splotches. A low, steady hum fills the air from an unknown source, the acoustics of the space causing distorting reverberations.

node.name: Guildmaster's Office
node.description: With its riot of colors and textures, this room demands attention. Swathes of vibrant batiked fabrics cover the walls and a wide river reed mat spreads across the floor, muffling the sound of footsteps upon the stone beneath. Exotic cave-dwelling plants grow in the brightly enameled pots that rest upon nearly every available surface, except for the coral-edged driftwood desk that sits catty-corner to the door. The desk itself is piled so high with scrolls as to nearly eclipse the numerous trinkets that vie with them for space.

node.name: Cavern, Clinical Laboratory
node.description: Scrubbed and polished, the stone walls and floor of this room are extremely clean, as are its furnishings. A gleaming steel operating table sits centered beneath several brightly glowing gaethzen orbs, while instrument racks line the north wall, providing easy access to the surgical tools held within. Two sturdily reinforced cages, one large and one small, sit against the wall opposite the door.

node.name: Cavern, Visceral Laboratory
node.description: This laboratory seems as though it has never been cleaned, every surface bearing bloodstains both fresh and old. Stone slabs illuminated by sputtering oil lamps provide experimentation surfaces, while buckets hold an assortment of tools from the mundane to the bizarre. Burlap sacks streaked with gore sit piled in one corner, awaiting disposal.

node.name: Cavern, Shady Merchant
node.description: Wooden boards are set up to hide the cavern walls, giving the interior of this small room a feel similar to the interior of a ship. Sailcloth curtains hang in long drapes from each of the walls, each one weathered from long use. A large stuffed swordfish hangs on the western wall, its scales glinting in the dim candlelight.

node.name: Item Registration
node.description: The small room is predominated by a large desk in the center, with stacks of unsorted papers on the shelves. Most of the papers are filled either with childish drawings of fish, nonsensical poems and short paragraphs of near gibberish, or angry rants. Chaos and disorganization are predominant, although one very neat stack of papers is arranged in a small box on the desk.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Dank Stairwell
node.description: Crumbled stone litters each step, making walking difficult. Dampness radiates from the close walls as the *plink* of dripping water echoes in the narrow stairwell.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Dank Stairwell
node.description: Crumbled stone litters each step, making walking difficult. Dampness radiates from the close walls as the *plink* of dripping water echoes in the narrow stairwell.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Dank Stairwell
node.description: Crumbled stone litters each step, making walking difficult. Dampness radiates from the close walls as the *plink* of dripping water echoes in the narrow stairwell.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Anthology Cellar
node.description: Quite unlike the dark, dreary passage that brings one here, this cellar room is cozy and warm, seemingly untouched by the world outside. A large rug covers the floor, and colorful tapestries hang on every wall. Not only does the multitude of thick fabrics keep out the chill, they also provide insulation from sound, making this a very quiet room. Tall sconces rise from the floor, their contents providing light and warmth, while rocking chairs offer comfortable seating.

node.name: Bards' Guild, Terrace Gazebo
node.description: Cedar beams, silvered with age, rise upwards to bury themselves in the mass of ivy that has overgrown the slatwork ceiling. Questing tendrils of jasmine curtain the lattice walls of the gazebo with heavy pink blossoms. Wide pine benches line the eight edges of the smooth decking and the sharp scent of cedar intermingles with the rich perfume of fresh growth and jasmine.

node.name: Riverhaven Meeting Hall, Entrance
node.description: A small building overlooking the water, the meeting Hall is made out of rough planks of repurposed wood. Heavy glass windows overlook the water, and a few marsh plants grow in pots on opposite sides of the exit. A piece of sailcloth covers the wall and runs the length of the long hallway, stained heavily with salt and smelling of the sea.

node.name: Riverhaven Meeting Hall, Corridor
node.description: Torches in iron sconces illuminate the hallway, set into the walls in even intervals and burning with a bright light. Salt-stained driftwood paneling covers the walls, and several trophies of various types of fish are proudly on display. A large sailcloth runs the full length of the outer wall, a section of it stenciled with a fleet of sailing ships.

node.name: Riverhaven Meeting Hall, Dock
node.description: The eastern end of the meeting hall opens up into a small dock open to the air, though well sheltered by the slanting roof and long curtains of sailcloth. The ceiling is peaked slightly, showing off the underside of the roof as tall and sturdy rafters. Boards of polished and darkly stained driftwood make up the floor, giving it a rustic feel.

node.name: Fisher's Meeting Room
node.description: Carved wooden fish cover the low walls of the meeting room, and a small arrangement of lilies grows in a wide stone bowl in one corner. Several rows of high-backed benches are arranged in the center of the room, each roughly carved from sturdy strips of waterproofed oak. A small window looks out on the river below, which fills the room with a quiet rushing noise.

node.name: Hunter's Meeting Room
node.description: Skins and busts from various animals are arranged the low walls of the meeting room, and small ferns grow in stone pots in one corner. Several rows of high-backed benches are arranged in the center of the room, each roughly carved from sturdy strips of waterproofed oak. A small window looks out on the river below, giving a distant view of the far bank.

node.name: Riverhaven Meeting Hall, Lounge
node.description: Candles adorn the many surfaces within the room, casting their fickle, flickering light across the area. Rough-hewn wooden walls, dressed up with several trophies of past catches, encircle a floor that's made of bare wood. Long sailcloth couches are arranged in the middle of the room, set up for quiet talking.

node.name: Swamp Meeting Room
node.description: A heavy swamp motif decorates the low walls of the meeting room, and small marsh plants grow in stone pots in one corner. Several rows of high-backed benches are arranged in the center of the room, each roughly carved from sturdy strips of waterproofed oak. A small window looks out on the river below, its frame decorated with several small designs.

node.name: Meeting Houseboat
node.description: The small craft constantly rocks slightly from side to side, riding fairly high in the water as it remains tethered to the dock. Several rows of high-backed benches are arranged in the center of the boat, each roughly carved from sturdy strips of waterproofed oak. Small round windows look out from the craft, positioned to be just above the waterline.

node.name: Riverside Meeting Room
node.description: A large mural of Riverhaven proper covers the low walls of the meeting room, and small blue flowers grow in stone pots in one corner. Several rows of high-backed benches are arranged in the center of the room, each roughly carved from sturdy strips of waterproofed oak. A small window looks out on the river below, though part of it is taken up by the ship docked nearby.

node.name: Riverhaven Enchanting Society, Entrance
node.description: Arched windows on either side of the doorway let the twilight into the Enchanter's Society, the area lit up with numerous torches and muted somewhat with dark grey carpet runners. High above, the ceiling rises in a pointed dome, the spaces between the rafters painted with numerous stormy clouds. Potted plants add a hint of green to the otherwise monochrome decor.

Arched windows on either side of the doorway illuminate the busy entrance of the Enchanter's Society, the dark marble floor shot through with veins of silver and muted somewhat with dark grey carpet runners. High above, the ceiling rises in a pointed dome, the spaces between the rafters painted with numerous stormy clouds. Potted plants add a hint of green to the otherwise monochrome decor.

node.name: Riverhaven Enchanting Society, Emerald Hall
node.description: Numerous plants in ornate pots line the hallway, the deep green marble floor running from east to west. Most are in various states of bloom, and a few adventurous vines creep up the marble pillars that line either side of the hall. More plants are painted onto the walls, and the hallway is lit with several gaethzen orbs behind triangular panes of green glass.

node.name: Riverhaven Enchanting Society, Cerulean Hall
node.description: Light blue hues cover the eastern wall and ceiling, varying in vibrant shades that mimic a cloudless noon sky. Deeper blue paneling comes halfway up the walls, peaked at points to resemble ocean waves. To the west, the colors fade from blue into green, meeting to form a teal color in the center of the long corridor.

node.name: Riverhaven Enchanting Society, Amethyst Hall
node.description: Delicate purple hues cover the entirety of the walls, enhanced somewhat by a large chandelier hanging from the high ceiling. Teardrop-cut amethysts hang from the chandelier's multifaceted arms, scattering about flecks of light that range from deep violet to an almost transparent blue. The colors painted on the walls vary in subtle shaded tones, giving the appearance of flowing and untamed aether.

node.name: Riverhaven Society Master's Office of Enchanting
node.description: A single arched picture window gives a good view of the nighttime sky outside, and the high domed ceiling makes it feel larger than it really is. Near the window is a large mahogany desk with an overstuffed chair behind it, while two much smaller chairs are placed in front of it as almost a careless afterthought. Bookshelves line the walls, their contents kept meticulously neat and tidy.

A single arched picture window lets copious amounts of daylight into the room, and the high domed ceiling makes it feel larger than it really is. Near the window is a large mahogany desk with an overstuffed chair behind it, while two much smaller chairs are placed in front of it as almost a careless afterthought. Shelves line the walls, their contents kept meticulously neat and tidy.

node.name: Riverhaven Enchanting Society, Citrine Hall
node.description: Carefully set crystals and panes of reddish orange glass give the appearance of fire crackling over the walls, the effect heavily stylized and abstract. Light plays across the walls in fiery tones, reflecting off gemstones placed in flame mosaics. Several large torches burn on their pillars on either side of the long hallway, which is completed with dark red carpeting flecked with occasional streaks of golden thread.

node.name: Riverhaven Enchanting Society, Supply Store
node.description: Large volumes of deep red fabric hang from the walls in heavily draping sheets, enclosing the room and giving it a soft feel. Wares for sale are laid out on cloth-covered tables, lit by candles that hang from the ceiling in enclosed lanterns. A vase of firewheel flowers adorns a corner table, their broad petals red at the base and tipped with yellow.

node.name: Riverhaven Enchanting Society, Tool Store
node.description: Light from gaethzen orbs shines down from each cardinal point of the room, illuminating the numerous wares for sale. Framed pictures hang on the stone walls, each depicting a complex formula or theory of artificing. Embroidered into the carpet is an enormous compass, oriented so its northern needle points in the correct direction.

node.name: Riverhaven Enchanting Society, Book Store
node.description: Numerous wooden shelves line the stone walls, each shelf crafted from a rich mahogany that is polished until glistening. Tomes and manuscripts fill them, most displayed for sale but a few on the top shelf being labeled as 'do not touch'. Only a few muted lanterns light the room, the low illumination protecting the more fragile of the aging parchments.

node.name: Riverhaven Enchanting Society, Iron Workroom
node.description: Metal tables provide ample working space, yet are easily moved out of the way for larger incantations. The plain marble floor gives the rest of the building some protection against errant spells, while small windows in the ceiling allow for the fast removal of smoke and other fumes. Acoustically dampened walls dissolve away the echoes of most sounds, making for few distractions in the room.
